reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 7763, 'name': 'Alexei Kornienko', 'email': 'akornienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akornienko'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2013-07-08 14:30:03.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrate.py'], 'message': 'Add a monkey-patching util for sqlalchemy-migrate

Nova and other projects use sqlalchemy-migrate for DB schema
migrations. Unfortunately, this project looks like to be dead,
but have some important bugs which makes lives of OpenStack
developers harder (e. g. creation of a new unique constraint
in SQLite leads to deletion of all existing unique constraints).

Nova has some workarounds for bugs and limitations of sqlalchemy-migrate,
though it would be nice to have those directly in sqlalchemy-migrate
(at least in form of a monkey-patch for now). Oslo seems to be
a good place to store this monkey-patch, so Nova and other projects
could reuse it.

This patch:
  - makes it possible to use the unified drop_unique_constraint()
    function for SQLite backend
  - fixes a bug in sqlalchemy-migrate that leads to deletion of
    existing unique constraints of a table when a new one is added
    (SQLite backend)

Blueprint: oslo-sqlalchemy-migrate-uc-fixes

Change-Id: Ifac07abac3814b3ea4dea5840b17a711f4b24b8d
'}]
commit_message:
Add a monkey-patching util for sqlalchemy-migrate

Nova and other projects use sqlalchemy-migrate for DB schema
migrations. Unfortunately, this project looks like to be dead,
but have some important bugs which makes lives of OpenStack
developers harder (e. g. creation of a new unique constraint
in SQLite leads to deletion of all existing unique constraints).

Nova has some workarounds for bugs and limitations of sqlalchemy-migrate,
though it would be nice to have those directly in sqlalchemy-migrate
(at least in form of a monkey-patch for now). Oslo seems to be
a good place to store this monkey-patch, so Nova and other projects
could reuse it.

This patch:
  - makes it possible to use the unified drop_unique_constraint()
    function for SQLite backend
  - fixes a bug in sqlalchemy-migrate that leads to deletion of
    existing unique constraints of a table when a new one is added
    (SQLite backend)

Blueprint: oslo-sqlalchemy-migrate-uc-fixes

Change-Id: Ifac07abac3814b3ea4dea5840b17a711f4b24b8d

commit_message:
Adding store location proxy to domain

Adding a proxy layer to image to take care of it's locations for the
store:
1. Image location correctness checking.
2. Remove image data from the store when a location is removed from an
image.

Implement bp: multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: Ifa8b19050b48d1099aa37e77d144d10e6587b99c
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Modify check for volume-type-id to a get w/default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-04 00:34:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Modify check for volume-type-id to a get w/default

While implementing Fix for a previous bug to enable setting
volume type on a cloned volume and reading it's info we added
a vref['volume_type_id'], problem is that the _do_clone method
is shared for both clone and create from snapshot.

In the create from snapshot case however that key doesn't exist
in the vref (which is a snapshot object).

This change turns this into a key.get with a default return.

Fixes bug: 1192745

Change-Id: I1a6d38de614f54fcaa31ea7cc4250aacc85b0796
(cherry picked from commit 48389857d15c5cda860fa8f9914d62b148bfd17a)
"}]
commit_message:
Modify check for volume-type-id to a get w/default

While implementing Fix for a previous bug to enable setting
volume type on a cloned volume and reading it's info we added
a vref['volume_type_id'], problem is that the _do_clone method
is shared for both clone and create from snapshot.

In the create from snapshot case however that key doesn't exist
in the vref (which is a snapshot object).

This change turns this into a key.get with a default return.

Fixes bug: 1192745

Change-Id: I1a6d38de614f54fcaa31ea7cc4250aacc85b0796
(cherry picked from commit 48389857d15c5cda860fa8f9914d62b148bfd17a)

commit_message:
Remove redundant description about virtual cores

This sentence in Overcommitting section in Compute Nodes section is
talking about the relation between the number of physical cores and
its allocation ratio, so the number of virtual cores on each VM is
unnecessary.

Fixes bug 1199925

Change-Id: I96fb0ba093bc9a4f84131848ab07245ca99050d7

subject: Add Docbook XML mode in tools/generatedocbook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-09 05:22:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/generatedocbook'], 'message': 'Add Docbook XML mode in tools/generatedocbook

tools/generatepot uses Docbook XML mode.
It replaces elements of several types with placeholder.

  eg: <command>ps aux</command>  ->  <placeholder-1>
      [aaa.xml]
        run <command>ps aux</command>.
      [aaa.pot]
        msgid "run <placeholder-1>."
        msgstr ""

Then, translatores translate strings with placeholder.

  eg: [ja.po]
        msgid "run <placeholder-1>."
        msgstr "<placeholder-1> wo jikkou."

So, tools/generatedocbook need to merge the tranlation strings,
considering Docbook format.

If not be considered, the strings containing a placeholder
element remains untranslated because msgid does not match.

  eg: [aaa.xml]
        run <command>ps aux</command>.
      [ja.po]
        msgid "run <placeholder-1>."    <- not match
        msgstr "<placeholder-1> wo jikkou."

Change-Id: Ieb32ed8bfb0b6880040e47e3700b812f81598d8a
'}]
commit_message:
Add Docbook XML mode in tools/generatedocbook

tools/generatepot uses Docbook XML mode.
It replaces elements of several types with placeholder.

  eg: <command>ps aux</command>  ->  <placeholder-1>
      [aaa.xml]
        run <command>ps aux</command>.
      [aaa.pot]
        msgid "run <placeholder-1>."
        msgstr ""

Then, translatores translate strings with placeholder.

  eg: [ja.po]
        msgid "run <placeholder-1>."
        msgstr "<placeholder-1> wo jikkou."

So, tools/generatedocbook need to merge the tranlation strings,
considering Docbook format.

If not be considered, the strings containing a placeholder
element remains untranslated because msgid does not match.

  eg: [aaa.xml]
        run <command>ps aux</command>.
      [ja.po]
        msgid "run <placeholder-1>."    <- not match
        msgstr "<placeholder-1> wo jikkou."

Change-Id: Ieb32ed8bfb0b6880040e47e3700b812f81598d8a

commit_message:
Add a function to remove fk constraint in SQLite

Deleting foreign key constraint is not supported by sqlite.
This change adds workaround for this.

(Deleting FK needed by downgrade migration)

bug: 1189462

Change-Id: I3bfff40a04158bfb136f7014ec4775c216931951

commit_message:
Allow creating multiple vips per pool in lbaas

Add ability to create several vips per one pool in lbaas.
For reference implementation all vips attached to the pool must share
single l2 port.

WIP implementation

Change-Id: I59822712b9b25446570f6830d959c63f16442193

subject: Added Support for VNC Kerberos Proxying to WebSocketProxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-25 20:30:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/console/krb.py', 'nova/console/websocketproxy.py', 'nova/console/sasl_helper.py'], 'message': 'Added Support for VNC Kerberos Proxying to WebSocketProxy

This introduces support for doing man-in-the-middle kerberos
encryption between the proxy and the hosts.  Two config options,
vnc_krb_auth and vnc_krb_username, are used to enable the option
(additionally, SASL and GSSAPI support will have to be enabled
for QEmu's VNC).  The proxy now pretends to be a RFB server and
and RFB client.   The "client" supports sec type 20 (SASL), while
the server supports sec type 1 (None).  Autodetects the host name
if it is an ip address using socket.gethostbyaddr(), and looking
for a host name that isn't localhost.

Fixes: bug #1194639
Change-Id: Idfc7c51f8fc95d152ce1dd3d860107d6a9004117
'}]
commit_message:
Added Support for VNC Kerberos Proxying to WebSocketProxy

This introduces support for doing man-in-the-middle kerberos
encryption between the proxy and the hosts.  Two config options,
vnc_krb_auth and vnc_krb_username, are used to enable the option
(additionally, SASL and GSSAPI support will have to be enabled
for QEmu's VNC).  The proxy now pretends to be a RFB server and
and RFB client.   The "client" supports sec type 20 (SASL), while
the server supports sec type 1 (None).  Autodetects the host name
if it is an ip address using socket.gethostbyaddr(), and looking
for a host name that isn't localhost.

Fixes: bug #1194639
Change-Id: Idfc7c51f8fc95d152ce1dd3d860107d6a9004117

subject: Remove SecGroup Id validation in nova-api for Quantum
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-07-03 09:28:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/security_group/quantum_driver.py'], 'message': 'Remove SecGroup Id validation in nova-api for Quantum

Quantum copes well with "invalid" identifier. Moreover raising
InvalidProperty on numerical ID leads to the situation where the same
input for get SecGroup by ID leads to different output depending on
the backing network implementation (Quantum vs Nova-Net)

Fix Bug #1182384

Change-Id: Ie02b36fe4833ef033947d6a2d97e08381aa1e54b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove SecGroup Id validation in nova-api for Quantum

Quantum copes well with "invalid" identifier. Moreover raising
InvalidProperty on numerical ID leads to the situation where the same
input for get SecGroup by ID leads to different output depending on
the backing network implementation (Quantum vs Nova-Net)

Fix Bug #1182384

Change-Id: Ie02b36fe4833ef033947d6a2d97e08381aa1e54b

commit_message:
Provide values for all nova compute params needed.

Previously these would have to be set for overcloud at runtime, but we
have good sane defaults now, and for nova-compute-instance we are able
to feed them in using the appropriate references with Fn::GetAtt.

Change-Id: Idfff2885bf2afa58b2dec84f06639198e411eae2

go unnoticed.

commit_message:
Sync latest rpc changes from oslo-incubator

Includes these commits:

 3006787 Sanitize passwords in _safe_log

 e204885 Optionally reject messages on exception.
 688832f Remove unused zmq relay functionality

Change-Id: I8629c271bc00571783f9b77ec36034945df9a583

subject: Bug #1198286 provider router demo is confusing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-10 13:07:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/app_demo_single_router.xml'], 'message': 'Bug #1198286 provider router demo is confusing

Change router ownership to the provider tenant.
Use more descriptive names for the tenants.
Clarify which users/tenants are doing what.
Note that the router can connect more networks from other tenants.
Simplify net-create by removing provider attribute parameters.
Made editorial changes - diane fleming

Change-Id: I89cc707ac815ed06e3dc648208fe4fb2008a802d
'}]
commit_message:
Bug #1198286 provider router demo is confusing

Change router ownership to the provider tenant.
Use more descriptive names for the tenants.
Clarify which users/tenants are doing what.
Note that the router can connect more networks from other tenants.
Simplify net-create by removing provider attribute parameters.
Made editorial changes - diane fleming

Change-Id: I89cc707ac815ed06e3dc648208fe4fb2008a802d

commit_message:
Add Instance.get_by_id() query method

This adds the ability to fetch instances by id (instead of just
by uuid). In order to do that, the following additional changes
were made:

1. Refactor the get_by_uuid() method to share more code, and
   also fix its use of a kwarg as a positional one
2. Add columns_to_join as a parameter to db.instance_get()

Note that #1 above required a bunch of trivial changes to the
existing instance tests for the new calling mechanism.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I83eb55c363062a3506c7f5dfa161d8072865f11d

commit_message:
xenapi: glance plugin should close connections

Current the xenapi glance plugin does not close
httplib connections when exceptions are raised.

Note this code is run under python 2.4 so with
is not available.

Fixes bug 1197846

subject: Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 22:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': "Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Ibe88c9bd2e090ba2ff42344564387b7e2b93e649
(cherry picked from commit 9c6187a8537333bea0886f5f058784d0a0a6705e)
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Ibe88c9bd2e090ba2ff42344564387b7e2b93e649
(cherry picked from commit 9c6187a8537333bea0886f5f058784d0a0a6705e)

commit_message:
Fix incompatible Storwize/SVC commands.

Inconsistencies in the command line syntax between Storwize/SVC
models and firmware versions caused driver failures. This patch
makes commands compatible to fix driver crashes on the V3700 and
controllers with firmware version 6.3.

Cherry-picked from f38f943899ea95fe237be1d096ceafd35b57a843

Change-Id: I51d5b97afa5419cdbf488f9e4e4597d22bb22f20
Fixes: bug 1163754
Fixed: bug 1163964

commit_message:
Select disk driver for libvirt+Xen according to the Xen version

There are two versions of the blktap [1] driver available under Xen.
blktap1 has been replaced by blktap2 that does not support "tap"
devices but "tap2", therefore we should use "tap2" devices by default.

Fixes bug 1188517
Fixes bug 1084618
DocImpact

Change-Id: I8b46885b0909de7cb51fd2d0f6ba2e9bcbf33cc6

commit_message:
openapproved: ignore patches with a negative VRIF

In addition to ignoring patches with a negative review, ignore patches
that fail jenkins tests. As a negative VRIF implies the patch isn't
ready to be approved again.

Clarify docstring, to point trying to identify trivial rebases only.

Change-Id: I812ad787cf6aa06d1ea05b2a0b70574b907b8777
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/36416
Approved: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Reviewed-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Spelling updates to openstack-security-guide.

Fixes a number of minor spelling issues picked up by running the aspell
en-US dictionary against the guide. Note that although the en-US
dictionary was used I have shied away from fixing issues where the only
cause of issue is en-GB V en-US but rather stuck to what I consider
appear to be clear mistakes.

Change-Id: I0bf73d31edbd0e8c42387716b4358934c78f7306

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-02 03:30:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Enable setting blocksize on volumes.

Currently libvirt assumes volumes to have
a block size of 512 when attaching to an instance.

Some back-ends however support other blocksizes (like 4096),
this change add a check from capabilities for physical and logical
block_size entries and updates volume meta-data appropriately.

This can then be used by nova virt to determine if it should pass in
non-default block_size info.

Existing metadata was chosen for now mostly to limit the impact
of the change and minimize risks as we'd like to backport this
to Grizzly.

Fixes bug: 1196248

Change-Id: Ie66e4f3709c10a319eadbf5a195d4404dcbb6b75
"}]
commit_message:
Enable setting blocksize on volumes.

Currently libvirt assumes volumes to have
a block size of 512 when attaching to an instance.

Some back-ends however support other blocksizes (like 4096),
this change add a check from capabilities for physical and logical
block_size entries and updates volume meta-data appropriately.

This can then be used by nova virt to determine if it should pass in
non-default block_size info.

Existing metadata was chosen for now mostly to limit the impact
of the change and minimize risks as we'd like to backport this
to Grizzly.

Fixes bug: 1196248

Change-Id: Ie66e4f3709c10a319eadbf5a195d4404dcbb6b75

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-07-10 17:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/storage/mongodb/queues.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/utils.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'marconi/storage/exceptions.py', 'marconi/tests/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/claims.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/messages.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the client.

This patch adds a safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to catch
ConnectionFailure and raise a ConnectionError instead. Future patches will make
the transport catch ConnectionError and handle it correctly instead of
propagating it to the client.

All storage back-end should support this.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I523232a7cefbd00082447403ceb3abada9af6db3
'}]
commit_message:
Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the client.

This patch adds a safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to catch
ConnectionFailure and raise a ConnectionError instead. Future patches will make
the transport catch ConnectionError and handle it correctly instead of
propagating it to the client.

All storage back-end should support this.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I523232a7cefbd00082447403ceb3abada9af6db3

commit_message:
Ensure /var/log/heat/engine.log is owned by heat

If heat-manage db_sync creates the logfile before the
heat engine service then it will be owned by root causing
heat-engine to error.

Fixes bug 1199789

Change-Id: Ib23a0d46ebf354a3293a64215715038497faf5b0

commit_message:
devstack: Add paths specific to XenServer Core

 * XenServer Core keeps its Xapi plugins in a different path to XenServer,
   in order to comply with the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard.

 * XenServer Core mounts devices under /dev/xen/blktap-2 in dom0,
   whereas XenServer mounts them under /dev/sm.

Change-Id: I0a66cd03f000f19c8ff63a8ae4231c00fda88380

subject: Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2013-07-10 04:24:34.000000000', 'files': ['tests/default_fixtures.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/pam.py', 'keystone/test.py', 'tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/sql.py', 'tests/test_migrate_nova_auth.py', 'tests/test_content_types.py', 'tests/test_backend_pam.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py', 'tests/test_keystoneclient.py', 'keystone/token/controllers.py', 'keystone/identity/core.py', 'keystone/contrib/user_crud/core.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/contrib/ec2/core.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py', 'tests/test_import_legacy.py', 'tests/test_backend.py', 'tests/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers

Currently there is a mixture of strategies in the v2 and v3 controllers
for how to get the roles assigned for the scope of the requested
authentication.  This duplicates code, is hard to maintain and in at
least once case (where your only roles on a project are due to a group
membership) is not actually correct (for v2 tokens).

This change does the following:

- Standardizes on using the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()', and its
  domain equivalent, for how roles are obtained to build a token.  This
  was already the case for v3 tokens.  The controllers no longer need
  to get metadata and extract the roles.
- Removes the driver level function to 'authorize_for_project' - this is
  now handled wihin the controller.  The driver simply supports the user
  authentication.

A nice (and planned for) sideffect of the above is that we now hide
the schema of how we store roles within the driver layer - i.e.
nothing outside of the driver (other than any specific-to-implementation
tests) have to know about how roles are stored in the metadata.  This paves
the way for a re-implementation of the grant tables in IceHouse.

This change also fills in missing function definitons in the assignment
driver.

Implements bp authenticate-role-rationalization

Change-Id: I75fc7f5f728649d40ab1c696b33bbcd88ea6edee
"}]
commit_message:
Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers

Currently there is a mixture of strategies in the v2 and v3 controllers
for how to get the roles assigned for the scope of the requested
authentication.  This duplicates code, is hard to maintain and in at
least once case (where your only roles on a project are due to a group
membership) is not actually correct (for v2 tokens).

This change does the following:

- Standardizes on using the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()', and its
  domain equivalent, for how roles are obtained to build a token.  This
  was already the case for v3 tokens.  The controllers no longer need
  to get metadata and extract the roles.
- Removes the driver level function to 'authorize_for_project' - this is
  now handled wihin the controller.  The driver simply supports the user
  authentication.

A nice (and planned for) sideffect of the above is that we now hide
the schema of how we store roles within the driver layer - i.e.
nothing outside of the driver (other than any specific-to-implementation
tests) have to know about how roles are stored in the metadata.  This paves
the way for a re-implementation of the grant tables in IceHouse.

This change also fills in missing function definitons in the assignment
driver.

Implements bp authenticate-role-rationalization

Change-Id: I75fc7f5f728649d40ab1c696b33bbcd88ea6edee

commit_message:
Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the
security groups extension and the corresponding unittests
to the v3 framework.

In v3, the management of security groups will be handled
by the networking service API. However, the dis/association
of security groups with instances still needs to be handled
by Nova. This change removes the security group management
code and ports the dis/association code to v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I617eee5660447bc61518b89eed73ce394f7435a2

commit_message:
Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I9cf1fb168283f9c76bac622d20719ac1bf7eb648

commit_message:
Set QPID_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode

When deploying OpenStack in a multi-node configuration,
the Qpid clients need the hostname of the potentially
remote Qpid server in order to permit the necessary RPC
communication between components.

Fixes bug #1196521

Change-Id: Iee3c3747cedea9488ec345e78f8eddbc6e850573

subject: Add cover/ to .gitignore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 05:02:08.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': 'Add cover/ to .gitignore

When we run "tox -e cover" to generate coverage report, testr will make
"cover" directory which contains the same html in "covhtml" made by
"./run_test.sh --coverage".  So, make git ignore this directory.

Change-Id: I829667a1ceb55418a5695545ad543a53f63821ba
'}]
commit_message:
Add cover/ to .gitignore

When we run "tox -e cover" to generate coverage report, testr will make
"cover" directory which contains the same html in "covhtml" made by
"./run_test.sh --coverage".  So, make git ignore this directory.

Change-Id: I829667a1ceb55418a5695545ad543a53f63821ba

subject: Add dbapi functions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-10 05:17:14.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/db/utils.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/db/api.py'], 'message': 'Add dbapi functions

1. add get_nodes_by_chassis
2. add chassis_list
3. add tests for new dbapi function
4. remove object created in setUp function in test

We need chassis_list when we get /chassis,
and we need get_nodes_by_chassis when we get /chassis/chassis_id/nodes.

I remove object created in setUp function because the object created in
setUp function will always exist in the db util test is over, so the
result of test_chassis_list will be effected by the object created in
setUp.

Change-Id: Ic2a743b764761935f847de0e0cdb0a2ebcec2486
'}]
commit_message:
Add dbapi functions

1. add get_nodes_by_chassis
2. add chassis_list
3. add tests for new dbapi function
4. remove object created in setUp function in test

We need chassis_list when we get /chassis,
and we need get_nodes_by_chassis when we get /chassis/chassis_id/nodes.

I remove object created in setUp function because the object created in
setUp function will always exist in the db util test is over, so the
result of test_chassis_list will be effected by the object created in
setUp.

Change-Id: Ic2a743b764761935f847de0e0cdb0a2ebcec2486

commit_message:
Validation added for missed scale/convert impl

It checks that specified plugin supports scale or convert features
before handling scale/convert requests by checking that this functions
has been overridden in plugin.

Fixes bug #1199072

Change-Id: Ifa39da576fe93ca25c19b8776950c44eb2468176

subject: Load config on every access
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 14:22:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/quantum.rb'], 'message': 'Load config on every access

quantum_conf will currently load the quantum
configuration from quantum.conf during prefetch
which leads to an empty quantum_conf and errors
stating the config file is not complete.

This patch changes quantum_conf to be reloaded
each time it is accessed.

Change-Id: Iff7a1dbb152cb7377f24eb0e51aff5d2224ec107
'}]
commit_message:
Load config on every access

quantum_conf will currently load the quantum
configuration from quantum.conf during prefetch
which leads to an empty quantum_conf and errors
stating the config file is not complete.

This patch changes quantum_conf to be reloaded
each time it is accessed.

Change-Id: Iff7a1dbb152cb7377f24eb0e51aff5d2224ec107

commit_message:
Also accept timeout parameter in FakeMemCache

When fake.cache is set, current master keystoneclient
is setting timeout= parameter instead of time= parameter
in set due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1095730

commit_message:
Basic cleanup for security guide pdf.

This is the result of a pass over the guide to fix some of the conversion
errors and other minor page layout issues in the pdf generation from the
new docbook source.

I also added company affiliation for the authors list.

Fixes: bug #1199516
Change-Id: I5035d790e29ee17d83f3b4966aa08917278a6870

subject: Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 13:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/fedora/root.d/10-fedora-cloud-image'], 'message': 'Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19

Fedora 19 cloud images are available here

  http://download.eng.pnq.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/releases/19/Images/x86_64/

Tested the qcow2 image with

  $ disk-image-create -o fedora-19 fedora \
  -a i386 2>&1 | tee /var/tmp/dib-log-f19.txt

Fixes 1199237

Change-Id: If2fb45bd1d528fb52b9c103b211eaf381834019c
'}]
commit_message:
Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19

Fedora 19 cloud images are available here

  http://download.eng.pnq.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/releases/19/Images/x86_64/

Tested the qcow2 image with

  $ disk-image-create -o fedora-19 fedora \
  -a i386 2>&1 | tee /var/tmp/dib-log-f19.txt

Fixes 1199237

Change-Id: If2fb45bd1d528fb52b9c103b211eaf381834019c

subject: Fix config option network_size typo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-12 20:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix config option network_size typo

The option is network_size instead of network_size_size. When
used in a larger cidr addr to create a network with nova-manage,
this config option is used and a NoSuchOptError is thrown.

Fix bug 1190354.

Change-Id: I08d8a525d1d0cb9fd527fb5e75401f81399d1f82
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config option network_size typo

The option is network_size instead of network_size_size. When
used in a larger cidr addr to create a network with nova-manage,
this config option is used and a NoSuchOptError is thrown.

Fix bug 1190354.

Change-Id: I08d8a525d1d0cb9fd527fb5e75401f81399d1f82

commit_message:
Quantum -> Neutron rename

Rename all paths to neutron, and almost all file entries,
except some of those in the nova.conf template(these have not been
ported to neutron yet).

This does not "Fix" bug 1199443 more accurately it avoids it. But
a rename would eventually be needed in tripleo anyway so doing
this now means we don't need to find/wait for a fix.

Fixes bug 1199443

Change-Id: I5e61fab1d444d90eb2c54ccfeefca5e148d96996

commit_message:
Fix misc issues with os-multinic v3 API extension

Fixes action names for the extension to be consistent with other
extensions

Replaces WebDav UnprocessableEntity return code with BadRequest
when the client body is bad

Cleanup exception handling

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ied433fe6cf93d6724201035120612036dec53283

Add "ExtendedVolumes" API extension

- adds v3 api porting as well

commit_message:
Add interface class for backup drivers

This fix introduces an interface class to define the structure of all backup
drivers. It also renames backup/service to backup/driver.
To be backward compatible a mapping functionality is introduced to map old
backup services to backup drivers.

Implements: blueprint refactor-backup-service

Change-Id: Ic3fca567111f4bd1b221689c73cd5c3bab4a777b

subject: Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 02:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet

Validation of the gateway IP address was taken place even
if the gateway IP was set to None; this was causing an
AddrFormatError exception to be raised by method
'_validate_gw_out_of_pools'. With this change we skip
the validation in case the gateway is set to None.

Fixes bug #1178273

Change-Id: Ib84378a4fd2cefdbbcacce695abbfaf82c647dd3
"}]
commit_message:
Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet

Validation of the gateway IP address was taken place even
if the gateway IP was set to None; this was causing an
AddrFormatError exception to be raised by method
'_validate_gw_out_of_pools'. With this change we skip
the validation in case the gateway is set to None.

Fixes bug #1178273

Change-Id: Ib84378a4fd2cefdbbcacce695abbfaf82c647dd3

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-07-09 13:19:40.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/wsgi.py', 'glance/common/rpc.py', 'glance/registry/api/v2/rpc.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_rpc.py'], 'message': "Add custom RPC(Des|S)erializer to common/rpc.py

We need a custom way to serialize / de-serialize some types in the rpc
API. Some of this custom serializations are worth moving to Oslo and
other aren't. Before going down that road, it is worth testing them and
make them a bit more stable.

This patch introduces a serializer and a de-serializer for Glance's RPC

Change-Id: I70c429c65d67cbd7ba09176d5f8e4e8f27270c5b
"}]
commit_message:
Add custom RPC(Des|S)erializer to common/rpc.py

We need a custom way to serialize / de-serialize some types in the rpc
API. Some of this custom serializations are worth moving to Oslo and
other aren't. Before going down that road, it is worth testing them and
make them a bit more stable.

This patch introduces a serializer and a de-serializer for Glance's RPC
API.

Implements blueprint registry-db-driver

Change-Id: I70c429c65d67cbd7ba09176d5f8e4e8f27270c5b

Since we do not populate fields when user selects template, we need to
distribute properties to between cluster and template

Change-Id: Ic201a4dd2db5812be4e2e3512e766740f13c7749
'}]
commit_message:
Remove AA from launch cluster dialog

Since we do not populate fields when user selects template, we need to
distribute properties to between cluster and template

commit_message:
Port user_data API to v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If8075f202800f333753aa571fc3acf5b1a9f4880

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82

commit_message:
Ensure that the neutron server is properly monkey patched

The legacy 'quantum-server' script will apply the eventlet
monkey patch whereas the new 'neutron-server' entry point
does not.  This prevents the server from properly handling
the REST interface.

Fixes bug #1199383

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82

commit_message:
Port images metadata functionality to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Note that this functionality will be moved from core to an
extension.  Consensus appears to be that we continue to need this
functionality for v3 because some deployers disable the public
image endpoint due security concerns and whether this will be
fixed in glance for Havana. Deployers can disable this extension
if they do not want it.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I900ff0f93bb790f4f7bbac66bb2437906cb905f5

subject: Allow storage url override for both auth vers.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-07-05 19:13:29.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tests/test_swiftclient.py', 'tests/utils.py', 'swiftclient/client.py', 'doc/manpages/swift.1'], 'message': "Allow storage url override for both auth vers.

When --os-storage-url is specified on the command-line to bin/swift, it
will override the used storage URL regardless of authentication for both
authentication version 1 and version 2.  This can be used to bypass a
load-balancer to hit a specific proxy server for testing/debugging
purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing the
desired storage URL into swiftclient.client.Conection.__init__() via the
os_options keyword argument.  For example:

  conn = Connection(auth_url, user, key, os_options={
    'object_storage_url': 'http://overridden.storage.url/AUTH_foo'})

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

Change-Id: Id2a36ed6abffd65e7762b6beea5bbfc6c036e848
"}]
commit_message:
Allow storage url override for both auth vers.

When --os-storage-url is specified on the command-line to bin/swift, it
will override the used storage URL regardless of authentication for both
authentication version 1 and version 2.  This can be used to bypass a
load-balancer to hit a specific proxy server for testing/debugging
purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing the
desired storage URL into swiftclient.client.Conection.__init__() via the
os_options keyword argument.  For example:

  conn = Connection(auth_url, user, key, os_options={
    'object_storage_url': 'http://overridden.storage.url/AUTH_foo'})

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

Change-Id: Id2a36ed6abffd65e7762b6beea5bbfc6c036e848

subject: Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 2861, 'name': 'Vincent Hou', 'email': 'shou@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'houshengbo'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7708, 'name': 'Sergey Vilgelm', 'username': 'svilgelm', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-08 14:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/test_quota.py'], 'message': "Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

DB API is an abstraction layer, which is used to make it
possible to switch DB backends easily (though we've got only
SQLAlchemy backend at the moment).

Public methods of DB API should not accept any backend-specific
arguments (i. e. a Session instance, that is an SQLAlchemy entity
to work with DB transactions).

This patch removes 'session' argument from all DB API public methods
(except volume_data_get_for_project() and snapshot_data_get_fro_project(),
which are a bit tricky and will be fixed by another patch).

If a DB API method must be called by another one in the context of a started
transaction, a private method is used. It accepts the same arguments as the
corresponding public method plus one additional argument to pass the transactional
context (in case of SQLAlchemy backend it's a Session instance).

Blueprint: db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Iabe7ea834ec07f6520614de2461b9ad1ab7a7ac2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

DB API is an abstraction layer, which is used to make it
possible to switch DB backends easily (though we've got only
SQLAlchemy backend at the moment).

Public methods of DB API should not accept any backend-specific
arguments (i. e. a Session instance, that is an SQLAlchemy entity
to work with DB transactions).

This patch removes 'session' argument from all DB API public methods
(except volume_data_get_for_project() and snapshot_data_get_fro_project(),
which are a bit tricky and will be fixed by another patch).

If a DB API method must be called by another one in the context of a started
transaction, a private method is used. It accepts the same arguments as the
corresponding public method plus one additional argument to pass the transactional
context (in case of SQLAlchemy backend it's a Session instance).

Blueprint: db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Iabe7ea834ec07f6520614de2461b9ad1ab7a7ac2

subject: Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-09 17:52:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race

A race existed where it was possible two greenthreads to attempt to create a
new info_cache or bw_usage record for a given instance. This would result in a
DBDuplicateEntry exception.

In both of these cases, first-one-wins is an acceptable solution, so we can
swallow the exception safely.

Fixes bug 1199468

Change-Id: Icc81bb013fa9dc142f88adbe4d11cdbd350230cc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race

A race existed where it was possible two greenthreads to attempt to create a
new info_cache or bw_usage record for a given instance. This would result in a
DBDuplicateEntry exception.

In both of these cases, first-one-wins is an acceptable solution, so we can
swallow the exception safely.

Fixes bug 1199468

subject: Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-03 14:13:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_hypervisors.py'], 'message': "Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles

The original search action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'

It doesn't follow REST principles.

So change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'

This follow the suggestion from
http://www.slideshare.net/apigee/restful-api-design-second-edition#btnNext at 77 pages.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I114868112e0dd719c046853de29df5cfa8dae6b5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles

The original search action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'

It doesn't follow REST principles.

So change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'

This follow the suggestion from
http://www.slideshare.net/apigee/restful-api-design-second-edition#btnNext at 77 pages.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I114868112e0dd719c046853de29df5cfa8dae6b5

subject: Remove boot-stack dependency on cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-10 05:00:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/element-deps', 'elements/boot-stack/bin/reset-db'], 'message': "Remove boot-stack dependency on cinder

Cinder is not used in all boot-stack environments, only in the
overcloud. We may want to have separate elements to initialise cinder
in the future, but that is speculative. Right now we only know that we
don't need cinder except when building overcloud images.

This was prompted by bug 1199412 occuring.

Change-Id: Ie7485f741aaef67599fb1fa2da381e23b6cbe805
"}]
commit_message:
Remove boot-stack dependency on cinder

Cinder is not used in all boot-stack environments, only in the
overcloud. We may want to have separate elements to initialise cinder
in the future, but that is speculative. Right now we only know that we
don't need cinder except when building overcloud images.

This was prompted by bug 1199412 occuring.

Change-Id: Ie7485f741aaef67599fb1fa2da381e23b6cbe805

subject: Use the runner interface as the best task lookup.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-07 03:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py', 'taskflow/patterns/resumption/logbook.py', 'taskflow/utils.py', 'taskflow/patterns/graph_flow.py'], 'message': 'Use the runner interface as the best task lookup.

Instead of having to examine tasks for requires
or provides or optional properties/attributes, have
the runner class do this instead and then have the
flows which use the runner class just access the known
to exist attributes directly.

Change-Id: I2db4ce5296bdbd50e882f5940572a4c513e73d20
'}]
commit_message:
Use the runner interface as the best task lookup.

Instead of having to examine tasks for requires
or provides or optional properties/attributes, have
the runner class do this instead and then have the
flows which use the runner class just access the known
to exist attributes directly.

Change-Id: I2db4ce5296bdbd50e882f5940572a4c513e73d20

subject: Unify creation/usage of uuids.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-07 05:18:23.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py', 'taskflow/patterns/resumption/logbook.py', 'taskflow/job.py', 'taskflow/utils.py', 'taskflow/patterns/base.py', 'taskflow/patterns/graph_flow.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_memory.py'], 'message': 'Unify creation/usage of uuids.

Instead of using the name it is likely better to
give the flows a uuid and use that for tracking
purposes rather than using the flow name (which
maybe duplicated). Also unify the usage of the
job tracking id -> uuid as well as adjust the
visibility of said uuids (to be read-only).

Change-Id: I592800bd9e08e3a7bde33ff250a454588324f052

commit_message:
Unify creation/usage of uuids.

Instead of using the name it is likely better to
give the flows a uuid and use that for tracking
purposes rather than using the flow name (which
maybe duplicated). Also unify the usage of the
job tracking id -> uuid as well as adjust the
visibility of said uuids (to be read-only).

Change-Id: I592800bd9e08e3a7bde33ff250a454588324f052

commit_message:
port Deferred_delete API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I43de158d32c03ffa416699e7f6835a7dbcd9e6bd

subject: python3: Fix unicode compatibility python2/python3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-24 16:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'novaclient/utils.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_availability_zone.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_servers.py', 'novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'python3: Fix unicode compatibility python2/python3

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings
more rigorously than python2. So use six.text_type/six.u()
where appropriate

Change-Id: I890e19cb857e10f0292aabdaebaa8e7a7bd8db23
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
python3: Fix unicode compatibility python2/python3

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings
more rigorously than python2. So use six.text_type/six.u()
where appropriate

Change-Id: I890e19cb857e10f0292aabdaebaa8e7a7bd8db23
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Handle errors raised by extend volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 02:32:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': "Handle errors raised by extend volume

Errors or exceptions raised by extend_volume in manage.py aren't handled.
This means the volume status will not be updated to 'error_extending' when an
error is raised during the process.

Fix bug #1199471

Change-Id: I1a76c317be6c340d7e21d97ebd35552493fd3842
"}]
commit_message:
Handle errors raised by extend volume

Errors or exceptions raised by extend_volume in manage.py aren't handled.
This means the volume status will not be updated to 'error_extending' when an
error is raised during the process.

Fix bug #1199471

Change-Id: I1a76c317be6c340d7e21d97ebd35552493fd3842

subject: Optimize some dictionary operations:
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-21 15:47:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/coverage_ext.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_instance_actions.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_networks.py', 'nova/tests/cells/fakes.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vif.py', 'nova/network/ldapdns.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_server_actions.py', 'nova/tests/virt/test_driver.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quota_classes.py', 'nova/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'nova/cmd/baremetal_manage.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_multiple_nodes.py', 'nova/tests/test_exception.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/db/utils.py', 'tools/lintstack.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/tilera.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_hosts.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/tests/test_flavors.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/views/versions.py', 'nova/tests/fake_ldap.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/aggregates.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/lpar.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/fake.py', 'nova/tests/image/test_fake.py', 'nova/tests/matchers.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_volumes.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/pxe.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/console/vmrc_manager.py', 'nova/quota.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/pool_states.py', 'nova/api/ec2/apirequest.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Optimize some dictionary operations:

1. Remove unnecessary calls to dict.keys(), which creates a new list.
If we don't need the list, just iterate over the dict without
calling keys().

2. When we iterate over a dict's keys and later get the corresponding
value within the loop, instead use iteritems() so that we get the value
when it's already handy, to save an additional hashtable lookup.

Change-Id: Ifa358c6f3d9f8c0ba57466d7ba7d79bb65a152a0
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize some dictionary operations:

1. Remove unnecessary calls to dict.keys(), which creates a new list.
If we don't need the list, just iterate over the dict without
calling keys().

2. When we iterate over a dict's keys and later get the corresponding
value within the loop, instead use iteritems() so that we get the value
when it's already handy, to save an additional hashtable lookup.

Change-Id: Ifa358c6f3d9f8c0ba57466d7ba7d79bb65a152a0

commit_message:
Use ccache to cache all compiles between builds.

Many python extensions are built from source each time an image is
built. Repeating these is wasteful, so ccache is employed to eliminate
that waste. A cache dir outside the chroot is used to speed up
subsequent image builds.

Change-Id: Ib73563ddbe5f3be7454bfc54ab91cedb559a1304

subject: Restart keystone in wipe-openstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-10 01:21:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/bin/wipe-openstack'], 'message': 'Restart keystone in wipe-openstack

Fixes bug 1199568

Depending on the timing on first boot if keystone is started
before os-refresh-config then the file /etc/keystone/logging.conf
will not be in place yet. Causing keystone to fail to start, needing
to be started again after os-config-applier is run but before
init-keystone.

After some recent changes, this is now consistently happening on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ifc979bad0ac351794a12ccda2dd97f277b79721b
'}]
commit_message:
Restart keystone in wipe-openstack

Fixes bug 1199568

Depending on the timing on first boot if keystone is started
before os-refresh-config then the file /etc/keystone/logging.conf
will not be in place yet. Causing keystone to fail to start, needing
to be started again after os-config-applier is run but before
init-keystone.

After some recent changes, this is now consistently happening on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ifc979bad0ac351794a12ccda2dd97f277b79721b

subject: Correct faulty Chef search query
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-08 21:56:41.000000000', 'files': ['libraries/roles.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb', 'spec/roles_spec.rb'], 'message': "Correct faulty Chef search query

The search returns a Hash, not a list, so we need
to remove the reference to [0] in the memcached_servers

in chef-client runs.

Change-Id: I479aca833a2eb80fa2baf3e54809b2edaa713b89
"}]
commit_message:
Correct faulty Chef search query

The search returns a Hash, not a list, so we need
to remove the reference to [0] in the memcached_servers
library routine call otherwise you get:

undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass

in chef-client runs.

Change-Id: I479aca833a2eb80fa2baf3e54809b2edaa713b89

subject: Handle AutoReconnect errors.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6971, 'name': 'Malini Kamalambal', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7044, 'name': 'Allan Metts', 'email': 'allan.metts@rackspace.com', 'username': 'ametts'}, {'_account_id': 7680, 'name': 'Alex Gaynor', 'email': 'alex.gaynor@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex_gaynor'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-23 09:05:28.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/storage/mongodb/utils.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/controllers.py', 'marconi/tests/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': 'Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c
'}]
commit_message:
Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c

subject: Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-22 18:54:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config

The horizon module adds a "Listen" directive to $httpd_listen_config_file,
which was httpd.conf. Since the apache module puts _its_ Listen
directive in ports.conf, there were two Listen directives which
caused httpd to fail to start.

Change-Id: Idaac1b3038a36d1908063b57487951ce8edb5862
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config

The horizon module adds a "Listen" directive to $httpd_listen_config_file,
which was httpd.conf. Since the apache module puts _its_ Listen
directive in ports.conf, there were two Listen directives which
caused httpd to fail to start.

Change-Id: Idaac1b3038a36d1908063b57487951ce8edb5862

commit_message:
Allow forcing the use of requested_networks

Providers may be using network extensions besides `os-networks`. This allows
them to handle requested networks POST data even if `os-networks` is disabled.

Fixes bug 1199442

Change-Id: Ib8ac78dcbe4f7d5a07fb5ea59507b603716d7435

commit_message:
Change default port for savanna api to 8386.

Since 8080 (the current default) is likely to be used
by other things.  Choose a new unassigned port as the
default.

Change-Id: I8bee3d880167e19810d06e7740842e930f06f9fb
Fixes: bug 1199226

commit_message:
Update bootstack-vm to match undercloud.

Also add Makefile stanza to produce overcoud.yaml from bootstack-vm
and nova-compute-group. This should allow independent usage of
nova-compute-group without having to manually update overcloud.

The manifest file should be empty. Previously, the data were saved into the
manifest file too, which could cause a false positive.
See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_large_objects.html

commit_message:
Fixed test - segmented upload of file

The manifest file should be empty. Previously, the data were saved into the
manifest file too, which could cause a false positive.
See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_large_objects.html

Made each segment different, not just data*10.

Change-Id: I6f5a10f2836d6c5d881486d29fc5714213ea4dc5

commit_message:
Fix launching of BfV instances

Fixes LP bug #1047568

Don't explicitly set volume size to 0, rather use the default from
nova.compute.api.API._volume_Size (currently 0, too :-) Also expose
properly in the UI.

Change-Id: I94e72a39d81ee8a7ebeebcac950cf7296372ca91

commit_message:
Implementation of a Heat stacks UI.

This change implements a UI to launch, manage and delete Heat stacks.

The launch screens are implemented with a set of chained forms where
the second form is dynamically built from the template in the first step.

A significant portion of this change was derived from
the work Dan Radez <dradez@redhat.com> did on thermal:
https://github.com/steveb/heat-horizon

UX flow revisions and basic test cases by Gabriel Hurley.

Implements blueprint: heat-ui

Change-Id: I294e93bed6da9dd3553e8b4a6a1c09b7c165a555

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-08 20:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['dev-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Allow use of oslo.config-1.2.0a3

See bug #1194807

We add a new dev-requirements.txt file because we don't want anything
not released to pypi to show up with the openstack pypi mirror which
is built from requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt.

Neutron and oslo-incubator already uses oslo.config 1.2.0a2. Nova used
it briefly but we hit an issue.

1.2.0a3 contains a fix for a regression in the registration of the oslo

"}]
commit_message:
Allow use of oslo.config-1.2.0a3

See bug #1194807

We add a new dev-requirements.txt file because we don't want anything
not released to pypi to show up with the openstack pypi mirror which
is built from requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt.

Neutron and oslo-incubator already uses oslo.config 1.2.0a2. Nova used
it briefly but we hit an issue.

1.2.0a3 contains a fix for a regression in the registration of the oslo
namespace package, so it doesn't make sense to allow a2.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c

commit_message:
Add location specific information to image locations db

This patch adds a column to the image_locations table.  The column
will store location specific information.  As a location is added
to an image there may be some meta data about that information that
needs to be stored with it.  For example, if it is a file:// URL,
information about the NFS server (host name, mount point) would be
needed in order for the URL to be useful.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: I6a96163abc8e4388e84cae2a8952f89d433210ff

subject: Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-09 08:06:09.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/glance_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/glance.rb'], 'message': 'Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready

Just b/c the glance service has started correctly does not
mean the service is actually running. Often, the service
is not operational and attempts to use the glance_image provider
results in connection errors.

This commit inserts code that allows the glance provider to
sleep for 10 seconds and perform a single retry.

The template for the code and tests was borrowed from keystone.

Change-Id: I565f1befea6ec3d2347f8e29c9aa05d5a312a827
'}]
commit_message:
Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready

Just b/c the glance service has started correctly does not
mean the service is actually running. Often, the service
is not operational and attempts to use the glance_image provider
results in connection errors.

This commit inserts code that allows the glance provider to
sleep for 10 seconds and perform a single retry.

The template for the code and tests was borrowed from keystone.

Change-Id: I565f1befea6ec3d2347f8e29c9aa05d5a312a827

commit_message:
Revert "docfix apache2 now supports client chunked encodin"

This reverts commit 68cb91097b75a92237bd90caffcd405c3e83cb53

Just so this is not get forgotten in the tree...

We are using daemon mode and chunked is not supported in this mode.

commit_message:
use tenant:* as swift r/w acl

The related swift patch has been merged
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22820/), so Glance here could support
this multi tenant sharing feature.

commit_message:
Export just the volume metadata for the database to be populated

Change I8c01ba3 retrieved the metadata from Cinder, however it did
not format the output correctly resulting in the metadata being lost
between Cinder and Nova.

This patch fixes Bug 1175571 correctly, ensuring that metadata is
transferred from Glance images to Cinder Volumes and on to Nova
instances.

Change-Id: Ie3a688e6bff539e09ec705ed901534f5829cf167

commit_message:
Update cinder root-wrap config

Fixes bug 1197048

Installs link to cinder-rootwrap and uses the
rootwrap filters from cinder repository. Without these
cinder fails to run any rootwrap commands.

Change-Id: Ibf6dc4b8db7909b4b95efdc1c8090391c226e8a7

subject: Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-09 18:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/install.d/01-boot-stack', 'elements/boot-stack/element-deps'], 'message': "Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder

Fixes bug 1199412

os-svc-install hasn't yet been installed so can't be used
specifically /opt/stack/venvs hasn't been created and virtualenv
isn't installed.

This commit will fix the problem building a image but bug 1197048
still exists, causing
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh/post-configure.d/72-cinder
to fail.

Change-Id: I3acc2c8b2304933634aeabf869bfed83c6135c9b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder

Fixes bug 1199412

os-svc-install hasn't yet been installed so can't be used
specifically /opt/stack/venvs hasn't been created and virtualenv
isn't installed.

This commit will fix the problem building a image but bug 1197048
still exists, causing
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh/post-configure.d/72-cinder
to fail.

Change-Id: I3acc2c8b2304933634aeabf869bfed83c6135c9b

commit_message:
Make sure periodic cleanup of instances continues on error

If an instance cleanup fails with an exception, no more instances
will be cleaned up. If the failure is permanent, this will block
other instances from being cleaned up for as long as it remains.

Resolves bug 1192712.

Change-Id: Ibdd69817ee0e6d0963637f38a8be3949e6e053ed

commit_message:
Disable describing of instances using deleted tags as filter.

Previously, one could retrieve instances using a deleted tag
filter that was once associated to the instance. The current change
disables describing instances via a deleted tag.

fixes bug #1197242

Change-Id: I2259594643ecdcf32c10c91c6585bd90bb768527

commit_message:
Implement grace period for claimed message lifetimes

This commit adds a grace period to claims such that claimed
messages are guaranteed not to expire before the claim
itself expires, plus an additional "grace" number of
seconds.

This provides fudge room so that when one worker crashes,
an alternate worker has some time to reclaim the orphaned
messages once they are released from the stalled claim.

Change-Id: Id0e194a85e67f20babfb97e441e11703d6bf5563
Implements: blueprint claimed-message-grace

commit_message:
Update kombu dependency to >2.4.7

* Kombu in the Guest needs to be updated to newer version, that
  has support for heartbeats.  The version in apt unfortunately
  does not.
* An additional dependency to the 'six' package is introduced
  by recent updates to oslo rpc

commit_message:
List migrations through Admin API

The os-migrations extension exposes endpoint to fetch all migrations.
The migrations can filtered by host and status. If cells are
enabled migrations can be listed for all cells or can be filtered for a
particular cell.

The route for fetching migrations for
a region is - v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations. Filters can be passed as
query parameters -
v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations?host=host1&status=finished&cell_name=Child

DocImpact

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-09 02:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/admin_actions.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_admin_actions.py'], 'message': 'Port admin-actions API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I11fd86cffb45851006338f8b6d2f87dad3aef467
'}]
commit_message:
Port admin-actions API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I11fd86cffb45851006338f8b6d2f87dad3aef467

subject: xenapi: Tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5044, 'name': 'Mate Lakat', 'email': 'mlakat@suse.com', 'username': 'mate-lakat'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 7952, 'name': 'Euan Harris', 'email': 'euan.harris@citrix.com', 'username': 'euanh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-07-03 09:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/xenstore.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/bittorrent', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/utils.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/migration', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/xenhost'], 'message': 'xenapi: Tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks

 * Rewrite xenhost._run_command and xenstore._run_command to use
   utils.make_subprocess and utils.finish_process
 * Change exception raised by utils.finish_process to retain information
   needed by calls in xenhost and xenstore

Change-Id: Idcdb50bededf0acde92f1774d6752043ba8f97ce
Fixes: bug #1074087
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks

 * Rewrite xenhost._run_command and xenstore._run_command to use
   utils.make_subprocess and utils.finish_process
 * Change exception raised by utils.finish_process to retain information
   needed by calls in xenhost and xenstore

Change-Id: Idcdb50bededf0acde92f1774d6752043ba8f97ce
Fixes: bug #1074087

subject: Sync install_venv_common from oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-07 14:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_venv_common.py'], 'message': 'Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: Ie3de2504fe08f751dbf3f06e4973716a51d7e25b
'}]
commit_message:
Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: Ie3de2504fe08f751dbf3f06e4973716a51d7e25b

subject: Move mysql_engine option to [database] group
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-07-06 03:13:33.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Move mysql_engine option to [database] group

We can not move the remaining db-related options to the [database] group
because they are defined in oslo-incubator.

sqlalchemy/models.py incorrectly sets options as default.
That's why we need to move mysql_engine to [database] group

Fixes: bug #1193499

Change-Id: Ic485fb28279e5ceeed6e21b4dee2a37a9eea6d6c
"}]
commit_message:
Move mysql_engine option to [database] group

We can not move the remaining db-related options to the [database] group
because they are defined in oslo-incubator.

sqlalchemy/models.py incorrectly sets options as default.
That's why we need to move mysql_engine to [database] group

Fixes: bug #1193499

Change-Id: Ic485fb28279e5ceeed6e21b4dee2a37a9eea6d6c

commit_message:
Ensure flake8 tests run on all api code

We need to exclude the plugins/xenserver directory
because the python2.4 code can't use as in except clauses.
The existing exclude directory accidentally included some
code in nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins and the related
tests. This code is now included in the flake8 tests,
and the current violations have been fixed up.

Fixes bug 1197858

Change-Id: Ib5f1b65d5d793f0f5854e898ca3ce751e43ef233

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2069, 'name': 'Yufang Zhang', 'email': 'yufang521247@gmail.com', 'username': 'yufang521247'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 3189, 'name': 'Chet Burgess', 'email': 'cfb@metacloud.com', 'username': 'cfb-n'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-07-08 20:48:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': "Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c
"}]
commit_message:
Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c

commit_message:
Xenapi shutdown should return True if vm is shutdown

clean and hard shutdown vm methods return a False if the vm
is currently shutdown. It should return a True, so that its
return value can be used to determine if the vm is shutdown
or not.

Fixes: bug #1195587
Change-Id: I758c43d45b15c3ef231e9eee3ecac620a44db824

commit_message:
Ignore any exceptions from rpc.cleanup().

When shutting down a service, we don't care what exceptions might occur
when doing rpc cleanup, so just ignore them.

commit_message:
Fix extent size issue when creating thin pool.

The LVM create thin pool rounds up extents, this
change rounds the free space down to an int to avoid
this issue and also cleans up some comments and
code around how PV's are set up and used.

Change-Id: I725aa819c21c38f464595d0146d6640ecd1e6440

commit_message:
port Service API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ia44030ac56cb09e4303900a178194127ae8e9a31

subject: Define behaviour for properties with None values.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-08 22:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_properties.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py'], 'message': "Define behaviour for properties with None values.

Now that Ref and Fn::GetAtt might return None values, behaviour for
properties with None values needs definition.

This change will treat a None value in the following way:
- if there is a default in the schema, that value will be used
- otherwise a default is used depending on the type ('', False, 0, [] {})

Fixes bug: #1192142

Change-Id: I59ae32c1c32b1bfede7d775aa845cd14246040e1
"}]
commit_message:
Define behaviour for properties with None values.

Now that Ref and Fn::GetAtt might return None values, behaviour for
properties with None values needs definition.

This change will treat a None value in the following way:
- if there is a default in the schema, that value will be used
- otherwise a default is used depending on the type ('', False, 0, [] {})

Fixes bug: #1192142

Change-Id: I59ae32c1c32b1bfede7d775aa845cd14246040e1
