This change is required for future works in the SolidFire driver.
New SolidFire features (such as extend) are only available in
the latest version of the SolidFire API.

Default to '1.0' for backward compatibility. SolidFire still supports
the '1.0' version in its latest release.

Change-Id: I93590ab297d746d65a58f9166d160d0c1d833014
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to specify SolidFire API version

This change is required for future works in the SolidFire driver.
New SolidFire features (such as extend) are only available in
the latest version of the SolidFire API.

Default to '1.0' for backward compatibility. SolidFire still supports
the '1.0' version in its latest release.

Change-Id: I93590ab297d746d65a58f9166d160d0c1d833014

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-07-08 22:45:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Refactor reschedule in exception handling of volume manager

Previous exception handling has a pitfall that may potentially clear
the sys.exc_info() (by calling SQLalchmey to update db). This patch
refactors some part of exception handling in create_volume() to make
sure sys.exc_info() is retrieved so that we can log and reraise it;
also we make sure exception be reraised at the end of exception handling
no matter the request is rescheduled or not.

As a side effect, we fixed a bug in unittest which didn't provide
correct argument to db API but previously this exception has been wrongly
consumed by volume manager's exception handling (not reraise exception
when request is rescheduled).

fix bug: 1197648

Change-Id: Idce5d06f8be1fb6018012503ec7f844898a21b25
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor reschedule in exception handling of volume manager

Previous exception handling has a pitfall that may potentially clear
the sys.exc_info() (by calling SQLalchmey to update db). This patch
refactors some part of exception handling in create_volume() to make
sure sys.exc_info() is retrieved so that we can log and reraise it;
also we make sure exception be reraised at the end of exception handling
no matter the request is rescheduled or not.

As a side effect, we fixed a bug in unittest which didn't provide
correct argument to db API but previously this exception has been wrongly
consumed by volume manager's exception handling (not reraise exception
when request is rescheduled).

fix bug: 1197648

Change-Id: Idce5d06f8be1fb6018012503ec7f844898a21b25

subject: SolidFire API RequestID is useless.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-09 01:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "SolidFire API RequestID is useless.

The SolidFire API can take an int or a string for a request-id,
when using an int however it needs to actually be a valid int.

The driver currently was doing an int(uuid) which is too large and
as a result get's truncated making it difficult or impossible to track
request-ids.

This patch chanes the generate request-id to form a hash of the uuid so
that it can be tracked.

Fixed bug: 1199198

Change-Id: I38d5e3d189e679678898c329a9fa173a47853d47
"}]
commit_message:
SolidFire API RequestID is useless.

The SolidFire API can take an int or a string for a request-id,
when using an int however it needs to actually be a valid int.

The driver currently was doing an int(uuid) which is too large and
as a result get's truncated making it difficult or impossible to track
request-ids.

This patch chanes the generate request-id to form a hash of the uuid so
that it can be tracked.

Fixed bug: 1199198

Change-Id: I38d5e3d189e679678898c329a9fa173a47853d47

subject: Enforce credentials requirement on stack create/update.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-04 22:08:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/api/openstack/v1/util.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Enforce credentials requirement on stack create/update.

Credentials need to be supplied whenever they are stored with the stack,
which is during stack create and update.

Some users have been relying on their auth token to perform all heat
operations (as all other openstack services support) however this has
led them to experience obscure errors when wait handles or alarms are
triggered.

Failing early with a clear error message will stop this class of errors.

Fixes bug: #1194303

Change-Id: I3edef3dee843bb06760be6294b798761eba30cb8
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce credentials requirement on stack create/update.

Credentials need to be supplied whenever they are stored with the stack,
which is during stack create and update.

Some users have been relying on their auth token to perform all heat
operations (as all other openstack services support) however this has
led them to experience obscure errors when wait handles or alarms are
triggered.

Failing early with a clear error message will stop this class of errors.

Fixes bug: #1194303

Change-Id: I3edef3dee843bb06760be6294b798761eba30cb8

Fixes bug 1191608

The code was not properly guarding against backing files not
existing with QCOW2 images. As such, get_disk_backing_file() would
return None, then the subsequent call to basename() on None would
cause an exception.

6e768363.

Change-Id: I4b1237ddf01b9398bfdc141180260136b36cae5a

commit_message:
libvirt fix resize/migrates with swap or ephemeral

Fixes bug 1191608

The code was not properly guarding against backing files not
existing with QCOW2 images. As such, get_disk_backing_file() would
return None, then the subsequent call to basename() on None would
cause an exception.

This bug was introduced with the fix for bug 1185588 and commit
6e768363.

Change-Id: I4b1237ddf01b9398bfdc141180260136b36cae5a

subject: Curl to redo the request (Found 302)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-09 11:09:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cache-url/bin/cache-url'], 'message': 'Curl to redo the request (Found 302)

The URL to download the Fedora 19 images is not persistent anymore,
they are now download from http://download.fedoraproject.org where the
request will be redirected to a different location. Passing the -L option
to the curl command will make it redo the request on the new place and
download the image correctly.

Related to bug #1199237

Change-Id: Ib9b9d65734992e2bf1a6888c5f2eb9de366f8204
'}]
commit_message:
Curl to redo the request (Found 302)

The URL to download the Fedora 19 images is not persistent anymore,
they are now download from http://download.fedoraproject.org where the
request will be redirected to a different location. Passing the -L option
to the curl command will make it redo the request on the new place and
download the image correctly.

Related to bug #1199237

Change-Id: Ib9b9d65734992e2bf1a6888c5f2eb9de366f8204

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-06-20 17:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py'], 'message': 'Preserve network order when using ConfigDrive

Pass network_info to be used by InstanceMetadata instead of fetching
it by API and losing originally requested network order. This is
similar to what has been done for "content" where the original data
is lost after the initial call.

This issue only affects the ConfigDrive code path as the original
network_info is used when using file injection.

HyperV and XenApi are still probably affected by the bug but
unaffected by this fix. The fix is the same for these drivers. Simply
pass a network_info and it will be used instead of fetching the
network info by API.

Change-Id: Ie673b725cb47bf491009db99f6cb1258d46b0a69
Fixes: bug #1156844
'}]
commit_message:
Preserve network order when using ConfigDrive

Pass network_info to be used by InstanceMetadata instead of fetching
it by API and losing originally requested network order. This is
similar to what has been done for "content" where the original data
is lost after the initial call.

This issue only affects the ConfigDrive code path as the original
network_info is used when using file injection.

HyperV and XenApi are still probably affected by the bug but
unaffected by this fix. The fix is the same for these drivers. Simply
pass a network_info and it will be used instead of fetching the
network info by API.

Change-Id: Ie673b725cb47bf491009db99f6cb1258d46b0a69
Fixes: bug #1156844

commit_message:
Use the same logger class in all test cases

tempest.common.log is used by the most test cases,
but not all of them using it.

This change is aims to fix this anomaly.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-08 10:42:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/extended_availability_zone.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_extended_availability_zone.py'], 'message': 'Port extended-availability-zone API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I531a2d2f68a268d44eaef3a5af0a9c799787b188
'}]
commit_message:
Port extended-availability-zone API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I531a2d2f68a268d44eaef3a5af0a9c799787b188

commit_message:
Allow tenant ID for authentication

Under the Keystone v3 API Tenant names are not necessarily uniques
across Domains for a User, so the client should also allow
authentication by tenant_id

Fixes bug 1196486

Change-Id: I3f385a19c1d3d66f5539f901796bbaa22d315762

subject: Log cms_verify issues as warnings (not errors).
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-12 13:23:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/common/cms.py'], 'message': 'Log cms_verify issues as warnings (not errors).

In general we probably do want to log these types of errors... but
not as ERRORS. I think log Warning messages are probably more
appropriate here since it would be possible to hit this when
expired certs are refreshed...

Fixes LP Bug #1190230.

Change-Id: I0383f7e490ddcdfb31a62cd3760102152a8d16d9
'}]
commit_message:
Log cms_verify issues as warnings (not errors).

In general we probably do want to log these types of errors... but
not as ERRORS. I think log Warning messages are probably more
appropriate here since it would be possible to hit this when
expired certs are refreshed...

Fixes LP Bug #1190230.

Change-Id: I0383f7e490ddcdfb31a62cd3760102152a8d16d9

commit_message:
Divide dhcp and l3 agent scheduling into separate extensions

Rationale behind this is that some plugins may support only dhcp or l3 agent scheduling.
The patch is nothing more than refactoring. Functionality was not changed.

Fixes bug 1196806

Change-Id: Ie174059adfaed3028bbf65de7bde3497dd9bc664

* Add decorator 'extensions.expected_errors'.

Change-Id: I47cf83aff6e4c4dd998a310749a7b921caf89612

commit_message:
Use one action both for vnc and spice console in remote-consoles API v3

* To remove redundant actions merging 'get_vnc_console' and
'get_spice_console' into one action 'get_remote_console'.
* Catch 'exception.ConsoleTypeInvalid' explicitly.
* Add decorator 'extensions.expected_errors'.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I47cf83aff6e4c4dd998a310749a7b921caf89612

subject: Allows nova snapshot errors to be passed to glance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-19 19:25:10.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v1/images.py'], 'message': 'Allows nova snapshot errors to be passed to glance

Fixes bug 1191115

Patch will check for nova error property and set image to
killed if the current status is queued. This will allow
to differentiate between long running snapshots and error
conditions that can be reported right away via PUT request

Change-Id: Ibb0968f40cc99f0177dc6909ae08767442030472
'}]
commit_message:
Allows nova snapshot errors to be passed to glance

Fixes bug 1191115

Patch will check for nova error property and set image to
killed if the current status is queued. This will allow
to differentiate between long running snapshots and error
conditions that can be reported right away via PUT request

Change-Id: Ibb0968f40cc99f0177dc6909ae08767442030472

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.  This does not impact the current default policy
checking behavior.

Change-Id: I0f2ea9878e8903390159567cf9409d86256a94e8
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvements
'}]
commit_message:
Rule based access control improvements - attempt 2

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.  This does not impact the current default policy
checking behavior.

Change-Id: I0f2ea9878e8903390159567cf9409d86256a94e8
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvements

subject: Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-01 18:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/list_endpoints.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_list_endpoints.py'], 'message': 'Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Added ability to extract all in-use nodes from the 'endpoints' target.
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Changed the 'endpoints' target so it returns data from all rings and
added 'service' filter.
Added a 'raw' filter that provides more detail.

Added 'service' filter which allows the user to specify which service(s)
they are interested in.

Example:

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6011/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6012/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",

		"http://127.0.0.1:6041/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6042/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object
			Returns:

		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object\&raw

commit_message:
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Added ability to extract all in-use nodes from the 'endpoints' target.
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Changed the 'endpoints' target so it returns data from all rings and
added 'service' filter.
Added a 'raw' filter that provides more detail.

Added 'service' filter which allows the user to specify which service(s)
they are interested in.

Example:

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6011/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6012/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6021/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6022/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6031/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6032/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6041/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6042/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object\&raw
			Returns:
		[{"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6010,
		  "zone": 1},
		  {"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6020,
		  "zone": 2},
		  {"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6030,
		  "zone": 3},
		  {"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6040,
		  "zone": 4}]

Change-Id: Iab73ad9168a399061b964ad4bbbc7bd62d92e8de

Minor changes per review comments

Change-Id: Iab73ad9168a399061b964ad4bbbc7bd62d92e8de

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to

commit_message:
Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: I5efe196c46b12d88c853f8362ebcbf0cc6f1573d

subject: Adds Config Drive Support
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-26 19:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e

Set the correct URLs in the version return data

The URLs advertised in the data returned by keystone's '/' route default
to localhost and is not usable from off-host.  Not that anything in
DevStack uses it (yet).

subject: xenapi: cleanup VM Installation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-20 14:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/xen/install_os_domU.sh', 'tools/xen/scripts/install_ubuntu_template.sh', 'tools/xen/xenrc', 'tools/xen/README.md', 'tools/xen/scripts/install-os-vpx.sh'], 'message': 'xenapi: cleanup VM Installation

VM installation created a machine with multiple network interfaces. This
is a needless complexity at that point, we only need one interface. This
change removes the complex network interface setup from
install-os-vpx.sh script, so that only one network interface is created,
which is connected to the selected network (management by default). This
change also removes a lot of non-used code from install-os-vpx.sh
Specify the network to be used for ubuntu netinstall with:

    UBUNTU_INST_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME

defaults to $MGT_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME.

This change also includes:
 - use precise as default

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ib0a0a316e849f2c2651305ea657c84820cd2bb3b
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: cleanup VM Installation

VM installation created a machine with multiple network interfaces. This
is a needless complexity at that point, we only need one interface. This
change removes the complex network interface setup from
install-os-vpx.sh script, so that only one network interface is created,
which is connected to the selected network (management by default). This
change also removes a lot of non-used code from install-os-vpx.sh
Specify the network to be used for ubuntu netinstall with:

    UBUNTU_INST_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME

defaults to $MGT_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME.

This change also includes:
 - use precise as default

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ib0a0a316e849f2c2651305ea657c84820cd2bb3b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-24 16:14:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': "Avoid redefining host to none in get_instance_nw_info(...)

The host parameter is required and a part of the method signature.
When it is redefined from kwargs.get('host') the supplied value
gets redefined to None. This removes the redefinition and keeps the
parameter value intact.

Fixes bug #1194178

Change-Id: I779cbce909935a4b794c16cefb0128f16f8563fb

commit_message:
Avoid redefining host to none in get_instance_nw_info(...)

The host parameter is required and a part of the method signature.
When it is redefined from kwargs.get('host') the supplied value
gets redefined to None. This removes the redefinition and keeps the
parameter value intact.

Fixes bug #1194178

Change-Id: I779cbce909935a4b794c16cefb0128f16f8563fb

subject: Work without admin_token_auth middleware
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-07-03 21:19:12.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'tests/test_no_admin_token_auth.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Work without admin_token_auth middleware

Requests would fail with a 500 Internal Server Error if the
admin_token_auth middleware was removed from the paste pipeline.
The requests would fail because the code assumed that the context
contained an 'is_admin' element, but that element was only in
the context if the admin_token_auth middleware was in the
pipeline.

This change makes it so that if the admin_token_auth middleware
isn't in the paste pipeline requests will not fail with a
500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: Ic064785226ee70ee475d8f72fea3c2ae6971a07f
Fixes: bug 1190708
"}]
commit_message:
Work without admin_token_auth middleware

Requests would fail with a 500 Internal Server Error if the
admin_token_auth middleware was removed from the paste pipeline.
The requests would fail because the code assumed that the context
contained an 'is_admin' element, but that element was only in
the context if the admin_token_auth middleware was in the
pipeline.

This change makes it so that if the admin_token_auth middleware
isn't in the paste pipeline requests will not fail with a
500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: Ic064785226ee70ee475d8f72fea3c2ae6971a07f
Fixes: bug 1190708

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin
tenant cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I1e9a541ac46cd50faeb8f59196b6e17e202135c1
'}]
commit_message:
Orchestration tests to use admin user, demo tenant.

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin
tenant cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I1e9a541ac46cd50faeb8f59196b6e17e202135c1

Modified the version stamping script to stamp versions without need for templated fields to

Change-Id: I98af79fee8fec3ac131e54035d00ce0a8f855a63

commit_message:
Added logic to skip migrations for sqlite databases, as sqlite does not support altering
schema data.

Added non-py Alembic files to packaging process, as they must be present for
migration sprocessing to success in deployed environments.

Modified the version stamping script to stamp versions without need for templated fields to
be preserved, allowing for repeated calls to update scripts automatically. This is
especially useful for development purposes.

Change-Id: I98af79fee8fec3ac131e54035d00ce0a8f855a63

commit_message:
Remove property features from quantum_network

In a previously merged commit: 36144 , the feature implementation
of the quantum_network provider was removed b/c it was determined
to be faulty.

This commit removes the usage of features from the type, so that
properties that depend on those features can still be used.

subject: Remove extension checks for quantum_network.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-08 23:38:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_network/quantum.rb'], 'message': 'Remove extension checks for quantum_network.

 * The extension checks were failing if /etc/quantum/quantum.conf
   did not yet exist, which could easily be the case if quantum
   installation was attempted during the same run as provisioning.
   Since the checks are pointless anyway - the provider and l3
   extensions are essential parts of the quantum api - this change
   removes them.

Change-Id: I872d56b29ee4de8fefcd1e8ee0c0666cacccb533
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extension checks for quantum_network.

 * The extension checks were failing if /etc/quantum/quantum.conf
   did not yet exist, which could easily be the case if quantum
   installation was attempted during the same run as provisioning.
   Since the checks are pointless anyway - the provider and l3
   extensions are essential parts of the quantum api - this change
   removes them.

Change-Id: I872d56b29ee4de8fefcd1e8ee0c0666cacccb533

This adds functionality where a class can monitor for the global
engine changing.

This is useful for a class that caches the global engine and

Part of fix for bug 1179259

Change-Id: I5736a05308c63de9fccb8af7720ddd70530f4270
"}]
commit_message:
Add callbacks for set_global_engine

This adds functionality where a class can monitor for the global
engine changing.

This is useful for a class that caches the global engine and
wants to know when its cached global engine isn't valid anymore.

Part of fix for bug 1179259

commit_message:
Add no locals() for string formatting test

Using locals() for formatting strings is not as clear as explicit
dictionaries and can produce hidden errors during refactoring. locals() are
already being partially removed in nova and cinder. Related to
bug 1171936

subject: Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-08 21:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/quantumv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_quantumv2.py'], 'message': "Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot

bug 1175211

Using quantum dhcp agent the VM hostname does not
match the DNS name. Quantum writes dnsmasq config
file using the instances ip address with (dots
replaced with dashes) and the dhcp_domain name.
This causes issues on the instance (instance can't
look up it's own hostname).

Changing network/quantumv2/api.py to pass instance
name as port name to quantum port create.
This will provide quantum the ability to lookup
the port name that was set and write the dnsmasq
config file using the port name.

The relevant change in quantum will be in a future
commit.

Change-Id: Ie446ce6e54434b6f49234dd41d83dce3deeb8632
"}]
commit_message:
Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot

bug 1175211

Using quantum dhcp agent the VM hostname does not
match the DNS name. Quantum writes dnsmasq config
file using the instances ip address with (dots
replaced with dashes) and the dhcp_domain name.
This causes issues on the instance (instance can't
look up it's own hostname).

Changing network/quantumv2/api.py to pass instance
name as port name to quantum port create.
This will provide quantum the ability to lookup
the port name that was set and write the dnsmasq
config file using the port name.

The relevant change in quantum will be in a future
commit.

Change-Id: Ie446ce6e54434b6f49234dd41d83dce3deeb8632

subject: port Instance_usage_audit_log  API into v3 part1
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-02 23:29:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_instance_usage_audit_log.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/instance_usage_audit_log.py'], 'message': 'port Instance_usage_audit_log  API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Change-Id: I671ee9b3a0061195e9f387d60a63f74acb36bbfa

commit_message:
port Instance_usage_audit_log  API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Change-Id: I671ee9b3a0061195e9f387d60a63f74acb36bbfa

commit_message:
Notification support for host aggregate related operation

Add notification for the following operations related to host
aggregation:
1) Send notification when create a new host aggregation
2) Send notification when delete a host aggregation
3) Send notification when add host to a host aggregation
4) Send notification when delete host from host aggregation
5) Send notification when update host aggregation for aggregate
name and available zone
6) Send notification when update host aggregation meta data

Change-Id: I2dc42addb587c4765b41e464697f35b1f844fde9
Implements: blueprint notification-host-aggregate

subject: Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-07-06 15:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py', 'tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql.py', 'tests/test_v3_auth.py', 'tests/test_backend.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': 'Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles

The driver calls used by v3 token controllers to obtain roles
for a user on both project and domain were incorrectly implemented,
leading to roles being missed out of the token. v2 tokens are not
affected, since they don't use the same driver calls.

This fixes these functions and adds additonal tests to cover the
cases (all of which would fail without this patch).  As part of this
fix, the implementation of "get_roles_for_user_and_project() is
pulled up into the driver class (like the domain equivalent is already),
since, for all implementations, it is independant of backend technology.

Fixes bug 1197874

Change-Id: I59b6882d93bdc8372be03fed0b390b002a6d0320
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles

The driver calls used by v3 token controllers to obtain roles
for a user on both project and domain were incorrectly implemented,
leading to roles being missed out of the token. v2 tokens are not
affected, since they don't use the same driver calls.

This fixes these functions and adds additonal tests to cover the
cases (all of which would fail without this patch).  As part of this
fix, the implementation of "get_roles_for_user_and_project() is
pulled up into the driver class (like the domain equivalent is already),
since, for all implementations, it is independant of backend technology.

Fixes bug 1197874

Change-Id: I59b6882d93bdc8372be03fed0b390b002a6d0320

subject: auth_token expiration checks respect timezones
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-02 20:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'auth_token expiration checks respect timezones

The Keystone middleware now accepts auth tokens with expiration times
containing non-UTC timezones. Previously these timezones were ignored which
resulted in valid tokens being detected as expired.

Change-Id: Icb0124cf1e943ec6d826409fbeda77a592216bfe
Fixes: bug #1197120
'}]
commit_message:
auth_token expiration checks respect timezones

The Keystone middleware now accepts auth tokens with expiration times
containing non-UTC timezones. Previously these timezones were ignored which
resulted in valid tokens being detected as expired.

Change-Id: Icb0124cf1e943ec6d826409fbeda77a592216bfe
Fixes: bug #1197120

commit_message:
Fix os-svc-install outside of boot-stack.

os-svc-install is meant for any image, not just those installing a new
cloud, but it was only working so far because we've only been building
boot-stack images routinely.

Fix bug 1198701.

Change-Id: I4fd170333bb36b5bf9b0c33e224c43db2d4235f5

subject: Stop running apt-get during os-refresh-config.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-08 20:26:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/os-refresh-config/pre-configure.d/72-cinder', 'elements/cinder/install.d/72-cinder'], 'message': "Stop running apt-get during os-refresh-config.

All software installation is meant to happen during image build, not
execution. Cinder was breaking this because of it's requirement for a
dkms module. We added automatic building of dkms modules for all
kernels on the image when we sorted openvswitch out.

Fixes bug 1197371.

Change-Id: I6555a66ebdab3d4d7be927a802898bf483048590
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running apt-get during os-refresh-config.

All software installation is meant to happen during image build, not
execution. Cinder was breaking this because of it's requirement for a
dkms module. We added automatic building of dkms modules for all
kernels on the image when we sorted openvswitch out.

Fixes bug 1197371.

Change-Id: I6555a66ebdab3d4d7be927a802898bf483048590

commit_message:
Move boot-stack initialisation out of first-boot.

This permits the heat data to be updated by heat-localip, run by
os-refresh-config, before the keystone registration runs within
wipe-openstack. This is needed to generate correct registrations
for the undercloud control plane.

Change-Id: If686b56a3cc5fc45bbb40c4ec56a202576fa9b69

commit_message:
Move virtual power key generation to ORC.

To boot undercloud control planes with the right keystone endpoints
registered, we need to let os-refresh-config orchestrate the initial
setup, as os-refresh-config scripts setup the cloud metadata correctly
(specifically heat-localip).

Change-Id: Iab03bf37257db93726a7324da4f3023b736623b7

Change-Id: I2e2cb487cee64736ff1b5184e52b1ffd0e4620ad

commit_message:
Make virtual power ssh pubkey world readable.

On undercloud nodes we connect as heat-admin, not root, so we need a
non-root access path or we can't enable the power manager to login and
talk to libvirt.

The code was also a little messy, so tidied up the immediate context.

Change-Id: I2e2cb487cee64736ff1b5184e52b1ffd0e4620ad

Doing one giant delete for all the rows could be a disaster for

commit_message:
In sql token backend flush_tokens Delete gently.

Doing one giant delete for all the rows could be a disaster for
replication on MySQL, and also might introduce gap locks that will
prevent new tokens from being created.

Fixes bug #1188378

Change-Id: I1a7e00fb50afc3e3b3f2e10586453f219a381406

subject: Don't deallocate network if destroy time out
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-06-17 01:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py'], 'message': "Don't deallocate network if destroy time out

Fixes bug #1169057
Sames as bug 1180178, if libvirt returns time out error during destroy
an instance, we also can't deallocate the network of the instance,
otherwise the fixed ip of it may be re-used by another new instance,
and resulted in the new instance can't be accessed by the fixed ip.

Change-Id: I04dfd21bb1b7168abc71f39e836126a11dad6d8d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't deallocate network if destroy time out

Fixes bug #1169057
Sames as bug 1180178, if libvirt returns time out error during destroy
an instance, we also can't deallocate the network of the instance,
otherwise the fixed ip of it may be re-used by another new instance,
and resulted in the new instance can't be accessed by the fixed ip.

Change-Id: I04dfd21bb1b7168abc71f39e836126a11dad6d8d

subject: Enforce sqlite-specific flow in drop_unique_constraint
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-15 02:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py'], 'message': "Enforce sqlite-specific flow in drop_unique_constraint

The nova.db.sqlalchemy.apy.drop_unique_constraint method has a
sqlite-specific flow for dropping unique constraints because it can't
use alter table like mysql or postgresql. The code is explicitly
checking if the db engine is mysql or postgresql and then falls into a
block which assumes the backing db is sqlite. This can cause problems if
the backing db is not sqlite.

This patch simply switches the checks so that the sqlite-specific flow
is only ran if the backing db is sqlite, everything else will default to
the 'alter table' flow.

Change-Id: I23b9bf33d18df3ac36106d5800a8ecdd1a4018df
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce sqlite-specific flow in drop_unique_constraint

The nova.db.sqlalchemy.apy.drop_unique_constraint method has a
sqlite-specific flow for dropping unique constraints because it can't
use alter table like mysql or postgresql. The code is explicitly
checking if the db engine is mysql or postgresql and then falls into a
block which assumes the backing db is sqlite. This can cause problems if
the backing db is not sqlite.

This patch simply switches the checks so that the sqlite-specific flow
is only ran if the backing db is sqlite, everything else will default to
the 'alter table' flow.

Change-Id: I23b9bf33d18df3ac36106d5800a8ecdd1a4018df

subject: Add private_key property to resource.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-03 20:58:12.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/021_resource_private_key.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Add private_key property to resource.

This is needed for the Rackspace Cloud Servers resource.  The SSH key
pair is generated during the server creation, and the public key is
placed onto the server using the Cloud Servers "personalities"
feature.  When the handle_update method connects later on to transfer
the new metadata and run cfn-userdata, it will retrieve the private
key from the database in order to authenticate.

Change-Id: I626862ec0140bb9462313c858348356b51b1d074
'}]
commit_message:
Add private_key property to resource.

This is needed for the Rackspace Cloud Servers resource.  The SSH key
pair is generated during the server creation, and the public key is
placed onto the server using the Cloud Servers "personalities"
feature.  When the handle_update method connects later on to transfer
the new metadata and run cfn-userdata, it will retrieve the private
key from the database in order to authenticate.

Change-Id: I626862ec0140bb9462313c858348356b51b1d074

subject: Baremetal ensures node is off before powering on
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-07 13:54:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py'], 'message': 'Baremetal ensures node is off before powering on

During spawn(), ensure that a node is really off before trying to turn
it on. This fixes bug 1178919, in which a node that had previously
gotten stuck in a power-on state (eg, in the BIOS screen) would fail to
spawn() because the baremetal driver would send a power-on request, the
BMC would ignore it, and then baremetal driver would wait indefinitely
for a DHCP request.

Change-Id: Ie73e6ab488abe99c70ad3d149d702577941056d1
'}]
commit_message:
Baremetal ensures node is off before powering on

During spawn(), ensure that a node is really off before trying to turn
it on. This fixes bug 1178919, in which a node that had previously
gotten stuck in a power-on state (eg, in the BIOS screen) would fail to
spawn() because the baremetal driver would send a power-on request, the
BMC would ignore it, and then baremetal driver would wait indefinitely
for a DHCP request.

Change-Id: Ie73e6ab488abe99c70ad3d149d702577941056d1

commit_message:
Merge upload and verification of images sections

ch_images-uploading.xml and images-verifying-install.xml have duplicated
but out of sync informations. Merge details from ch_images-uploading.xml
in images-verifying-install.xml and remove the file from the book.

Also update the Image Service commands output to match the name and ID
used in the verifying section in the rest of the doc.

Change-Id: I60537f215617b7efd61af7aa87f1fa55da6f12d2

then checks the policy for each metadata against the matching instance.

Fixes bug #1192715

subject: Allow tasks access to mutable subflow.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-08 05:03:58.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py', 'taskflow/patterns/base.py', 'taskflow/patterns/graph_flow.py'], 'message': 'Allow tasks access to mutable subflow.

In order to allow tasks to provide back new
and fancy subflows as the result of the task
doing something (ex. making a decision to add
a few new tasks) we need a way to give a task
a mutable flow that they alone can add new
tasks into and which the parent flow will run
automatically if anything was added.

Change-Id: I8d929f51c50655335ad15c04a2486fc77643d20b
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tasks access to mutable subflow.

In order to allow tasks to provide back new
and fancy subflows as the result of the task
doing something (ex. making a decision to add
a few new tasks) we need a way to give a task
a mutable flow that they alone can add new
tasks into and which the parent flow will run
automatically if anything was added.

Change-Id: I8d929f51c50655335ad15c04a2486fc77643d20b

commit_message:
Fix and gate on E125

E125 continuation line does not distinguish itself from next logical
line.

E125 makes code more readable, and fixing all the existing issues allows
us to gate on this, making this one less thing reviewers have to check
for.

Fix was made using https://github.com/hhatto/autopep8

Change-Id: Ie569fd74fb84d220ceb87e37b1b1f39143bba80f

subject: Rename invalid domain name to be RFC compliant.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-01 03:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['tests/v1/test_legacy_shell.py', 'tests/v1/test_shell.py', 'tests/v2/test_shell_v2.py'], 'message': "Rename invalid domain name to be RFC compliant.

http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6761 and
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2606 define invalid domain names to
be used in contexts such as this. It's good to be compliant with RFCs.

Change-Id: Ibb7f9ee12c0c4331f8a33470def74c3a136ef6d9
"}]
commit_message:
Rename invalid domain name to be RFC compliant.

http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6761 and
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2606 define invalid domain names to
be used in contexts such as this. It's good to be compliant with RFCs.

Change-Id: Ibb7f9ee12c0c4331f8a33470def74c3a136ef6d9

DB2 will not allow you to rename a table if it's got a
constraint on it (a unique or foreign key constraint).

This fix changes the migrations so that the unique or FK
constraints are dropped from tables before renaming and then
restoring the unique FK constraints. This works for DB2 and
other DBMSs that support FK constraints such as MySQL with
InnoDB and PostgreSQL.

Also, for DB2, give a name to the unique constraints so that

commit_message:
DB2 migration support

DB2 will not allow you to rename a table if it's got a
constraint on it (a unique or foreign key constraint).

This fix changes the migrations so that the unique or FK
constraints are dropped from tables before renaming and then
restoring the unique FK constraints. This works for DB2 and
other DBMSs that support FK constraints such as MySQL with
InnoDB and PostgreSQL.

Also, for DB2, give a name to the unique constraints so that
they can be manipulated.

Fixes bug 1188785

Change-Id: I7cf6ab42084e43d827ed827c64025e61e72a4672

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-07-03 20:30:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py', 'tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql.py', 'tests/test_v3.py', 'keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/identity/controllers.py', 'tests/test_backend.py', 'tests/test_v3_identity.py', 'keystone/identity/routers.py', 'etc/policy.json'], 'message': 'Implement GET /role_assignment API call

Add support for the GET /role_assignment call as a first step
to making role_assignment a first class entity.

This patch also enables v3 collection filtering to match against
attributes of entities being returned in the list, using the same
dot notation (e.g. user.id) that we already support for policy file
checking against filters.

Limitations:

- The current implementation uses the standard v3 collections wrapper
  mechanism for filtering.  Given the potential numbers of role
  assignments in a large system, this may have performance and resource
  impacts.  A future improvement would pass the filters into the
  driver layer to keep the internal assignment processing to a minimum.

- The LDAP backend is not currently supported

Implements bp get-role-assignments

Change-Id: I6ff2ea780e39d7097a88214fbb3ddee1b924c30c
'}]
commit_message:
Implement GET /role_assignment API call

Add support for the GET /role_assignment call as a first step
to making role_assignment a first class entity.

This patch also enables v3 collection filtering to match against
attributes of entities being returned in the list, using the same
dot notation (e.g. user.id) that we already support for policy file
checking against filters.

Limitations:

- The current implementation uses the standard v3 collections wrapper
  mechanism for filtering.  Given the potential numbers of role
  assignments in a large system, this may have performance and resource
  impacts.  A future improvement would pass the filters into the
  driver layer to keep the internal assignment processing to a minimum.

- The LDAP backend is not currently supported

Implements bp get-role-assignments

Change-Id: I6ff2ea780e39d7097a88214fbb3ddee1b924c30c

commit_message:
Use python module loading to run glance-manage

Executing glance-manage in a unittest context means that we need
to install glance first, which breaks packaging workflow.

Fixes bug 1196275.

Change-Id: Idf0a332c2f2ffd3eb96d3623c32cf5383a0d9887

commit_message:
Remove conductor usage from consoleauth service

There's no reason for the consoleauth service to use the conductor API
since it is allowed to use the db directly.  Remove the single conductor
API call and replace it with the equivalent db call.

Fix bug 1190271.

Change-Id: Id6f50873f792ac4393dc2063f599f0418598091b

Sheepdog is a distributed block storage. This patch enables Sheepdog cluster
as a backend store for glance.

Test:

You can set up a simulated 3 node cluster on the local machine with
following script:

 $ sudo apt-get install liburcu-dev
 $ git clone git://github.com/collie/sheepdog.git
 $ cd sheepdog
 $ ./autogen.sh; ./configure --disable-corosync
 $ make; sudo make install
 $ for i in 0 1 2; do sheep /tmp/store$i -n -c local -z $i -p 700$i;done
 $ collie cluster format

Change-Id: I99907bbfc2e131146de9dd1a39f94a73cd2585e9

commit_message:
Add Sheepdog store

Sheepdog is a distributed block storage. This patch enables Sheepdog cluster
as a backend store for glance.

Test:

You can set up a simulated 3 node cluster on the local machine with
following script:

 $ sudo apt-get install liburcu-dev
 $ git clone git://github.com/collie/sheepdog.git
 $ cd sheepdog
 $ ./autogen.sh; ./configure --disable-corosync
 $ make; sudo make install
 $ for i in 0 1 2; do sheep /tmp/store$i -n -c local -z $i -p 700$i;done
 $ collie cluster format

Then change the default store in glance-api.conf as sheepdog

blueprint: add-sheepdog-support

Change-Id: I99907bbfc2e131146de9dd1a39f94a73cd2585e9

subject: Unable to re-use VLANs for multiple Neutron Networks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_db_v2.py', 'quantum/plugins/linuxbridge/db/l2network_db_v2.py', 'quantum/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_vlan.py', 'quantum/plugins/hyperv/db.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/linuxbridge/test_lb_db.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/mlnx/test_mlnx_db.py', 'quantum/plugins/mlnx/db/mlnx_db_v2.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_db.py'], 'message': 'Unable to re-use VLANs for multiple Neutron Networks

In some networks, the topology of the networks may
require sharing different layer 3 domains across the
same VLAN - perhaps in different availability zones.

To enable this use case, a configuration switch could
be added to enable re-use of the VLANs for specific
reservation. However, consistency must be maintained
for when a VLAN is auto-generated for use
(example - quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_db_v2.py
- reserve_vlan). In that case, the flag would not be
taken into account and would attempt to use an unused
vlan still.

Fixes bug 1196634

Change-Id: I535b50bfbd97442c2f79fa9d09df3fe96c5e49cb
'}]
commit_message:
Unable to re-use VLANs for multiple Neutron Networks

In some networks, the topology of the networks may
require sharing different layer 3 domains across the
same VLAN - perhaps in different availability zones.

To enable this use case, a configuration switch could
be added to enable re-use of the VLANs for specific
reservation. However, consistency must be maintained
for when a VLAN is auto-generated for use
(example - quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_db_v2.py
- reserve_vlan). In that case, the flag would not be
taken into account and would attempt to use an unused
vlan still.

Fixes bug 1196634

Change-Id: I535b50bfbd97442c2f79fa9d09df3fe96c5e49cb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2468, 'name': 'unicell', 'email': 'unicell@gmail.com', 'username': 'unicell'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 7543, 'name': 'Yongli He', 'email': 'yongli.he@intel.com', 'username': 'yongli.he'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-18 14:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_filters.py', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/scheduler/filters/compute_capabilities_filter.py'], 'message': 'Restrict ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to use scope format only

Per discussion in https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1039386, "scope
format" is adopted as a namespace in extra_spec to avoid conflict between
scheduler filters.

For filters still accept non-scope format, e.g.
ComputeCapabilitiesFilter and AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, using
together could still conflict for non-scope key format in extra_spec.

This change restrict ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to accept scope format
only.

Resolves bug 1191185
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3327dc37eead5a7415b2507769ecadf6a656d79b
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to use scope format only

Per discussion in https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1039386, "scope
format" is adopted as a namespace in extra_spec to avoid conflict between
scheduler filters.

For filters still accept non-scope format, e.g.
ComputeCapabilitiesFilter and AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, using
together could still conflict for non-scope key format in extra_spec.

This change restrict ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to accept scope format
only.

Resolves bug 1191185
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3327dc37eead5a7415b2507769ecadf6a656d79b

subject: notifier: do not rely on CONF.host
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-08 12:24:23.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_notifier.py', 'openstack/common/notifier/api.py'], 'message': "notifier: do not rely on CONF.host

There's nothing in Oslo declaring an 'host' configuration option, so
relying on it isn't a good practice. Let's use the same default value as
intended, but make it work in any case.

Change-Id: I9c898647e68e35435d1a58f920b6e610f217e4e8
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
notifier: do not rely on CONF.host

There's nothing in Oslo declaring an 'host' configuration option, so
relying on it isn't a good practice. Let's use the same default value as
intended, but make it work in any case.

Change-Id: I9c898647e68e35435d1a58f920b6e610f217e4e8
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

requirements processing.

commit_message:
Update pyparsing to 1.5.7

The version of cliff we are using depends on pyparsing>=1.5.7 but
python-quantumclient pulls 1.5.6 because it appears first in the
requirements processing.

The requirements change is in
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33406/

Fixes bug #1191866

Change-Id: Ib1c11b53813ff96b750f5ffe4997ad01907d32c3

subject: Fix stale process after unit tests complete
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 1313, 'name': 'yaguang', 'email': 'heut2008@gmail.com', 'username': 'heut2008'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-07 16:55:03.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_client_exceptions.py'], 'message': "Fix stale process after unit tests complete

After running the unit tests (eg with tox -epy27) a stale 'nosetests'
process was always left behind.  It left TCP ports open and held references on
inodes. The latter caused a problem with some automated build systems.

Rework the relevant test 'test_no_client_tracebacks' to be functionally
the same, but clean up fully.

Fixes bug 1198685.

Change-Id: If9d3afa370dc2bd3c470b509d38c94cfb5844518
"}]
commit_message:
Fix stale process after unit tests complete

After running the unit tests (eg with tox -epy27) a stale 'nosetests'
process was always left behind.  It left TCP ports open and held references on
inodes. The latter caused a problem with some automated build systems.

Rework the relevant test 'test_no_client_tracebacks' to be functionally
the same, but clean up fully.

Fixes bug 1198685.

Change-Id: If9d3afa370dc2bd3c470b509d38c94cfb5844518

subject: Prevent wrongly privilege escalation of a context
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-07-08 07:01:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/context.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Prevent wrongly privilege escalation of a context

Current codes in create_volume() may exists a scenario that
a context which is not elevated but after it fails in volume
creation, it becomes elevated. This patch saves original
context, so that if it fails in volume creation simply use the
original context for further scheduling.

Fix bug:1187076

Change-Id: I2822b1612ec741209b278fc65f18d0f8f3243e0a
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent wrongly privilege escalation of a context

Current codes in create_volume() may exists a scenario that
a context which is not elevated but after it fails in volume
creation, it becomes elevated. This patch saves original
context, so that if it fails in volume creation simply use the
original context for further scheduling.

Fix bug:1187076

Change-Id: I2822b1612ec741209b278fc65f18d0f8f3243e0a

subject: Make get_object_by_id() work for most Django objects.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-22 15:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/base.py'], 'message': 'Make get_object_by_id() work for most Django objects.

Django object id is usually an int while lookup is an unicode string.
It works for Openstack but not other Django objects.

This patch makes other standard Django apps reusing Horizon easier.

Change-Id: I436c34e8b17340537f8d201001741d34c933764e
'}]
commit_message:
Make get_object_by_id() work for most Django objects.

Django object id is usually an int while lookup is an unicode string.
It works for Openstack but not other Django objects.

This patch makes other standard Django apps reusing Horizon easier.

Change-Id: I436c34e8b17340537f8d201001741d34c933764e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-20 13:21:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/baremetal/pxe_config.template'], 'message': 'Add troubleshoot to baremetal PXE template.

We recently added an optional troubleshoot parameter to
diskimage_builder which defaults to 0 (false).

This commit adds the option to the Nova pxe_config.template
so it will be easier for people to find should they need to
enable troubleshooting mode.
Change-Id: I169a5e3b7a9d80e18e389ae4645d2c5bbdae2a6f

commit_message:
Add troubleshoot to baremetal PXE template.

We recently added an optional troubleshoot parameter to
diskimage_builder which defaults to 0 (false).

This commit adds the option to the Nova pxe_config.template
so it will be easier for people to find should they need to
enable troubleshooting mode.
Change-Id: I169a5e3b7a9d80e18e389ae4645d2c5bbdae2a6f

We already mostly use:

instead of:

So change remaining few cases to use nova.db instead of nova.db.api.

Change-Id: I6183352c4bbe77b88a5b277788f588b0b48c6476

commit_message:
Standardize use of nova.db

We already mostly use:
from nova import db
instead of:
import nova.db.api

So change remaining few cases to use nova.db instead of nova.db.api.
Help make code more uniform and easy to work with.

Change-Id: I6183352c4bbe77b88a5b277788f588b0b48c6476

commit_message:
Port coverage API into v3 part2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the hypervisor
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework.

And adding '_import_coverage' for ensure loading coverage module from
python-coverage.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I6a2dbf00d09132b767cd7972f68cb752b5961796

subject: Fix parsing of resource creation output.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-08 04:34:33.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/quantum_router/quantum.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/quantum_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_network/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_subnet/quantum.rb'], 'message': 'Fix parsing of resource creation output.

 * The results of resource creation were previously not being
   parsed at all, so that new instances would not have their
   property_hash properly populated.  This change ensures
   correct property_hash population.
 * Stop using an instance variable when a local variable (attrs)
   with do.

Change-Id: I88fe3ba964839762d5ad6a431d3d9ab876266fe9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parsing of resource creation output.

 * The results of resource creation were previously not being
   parsed at all, so that new instances would not have their
   property_hash properly populated.  This change ensures
   correct property_hash population.
 * Stop using an instance variable when a local variable (attrs)
   with do.

Change-Id: I88fe3ba964839762d5ad6a431d3d9ab876266fe9

commit_message:
Default to using the catalog for tenant lookup.

 * Only if the tenant cannot be found in the catalog will instances
   be used.
 * Replaced the get_tenant_id method in the providers with an inline
   call since it is only needed for create()

Change-Id: I1bb4b6d9998f9d334df10bf9b1f683c4f2f38150

commit_message:
Minor cleanup for the quantum_l3_ovs_bridge provider.

 * Use each() instead of collect() when iterating in
   bridge_ip_addresses.
 * Update the property_hash's value for ensure when the resource
   is created or destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib62c74c7a9ba38bdd57b263eeee94f370611b8b9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-05 13:11:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_tenant/keystone.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_tenant/keystone_spec.rb'], 'message': "Improve tenant_hash usage in keystone_tenant.

 * The tenant_hash used by the keystone_tenant type to keep track
   of tenants is now updated with new tenants as they are created.
 * Added 'instance' helper method that returns
   tenant_hash[resource[:name]]
 * Added spec tests for the changes.

Change-Id: I077e5012a3f2d20d3df4cc55f1150490d4b31f58
"}]
commit_message:
Improve tenant_hash usage in keystone_tenant.

 * The tenant_hash used by the keystone_tenant type to keep track
   of tenants is now updated with new tenants as they are created.
 * Added 'instance' helper method that returns
   tenant_hash[resource[:name]]
 * Added spec tests for the changes.

Change-Id: I077e5012a3f2d20d3df4cc55f1150490d4b31f58

commit_message:
engine : add suspend/resume support to User resource

When a User resource is in suspended state, disable the keystone
user owned by the resource

blueprint stack-suspend-resume

Change-Id: Iee8dddcfbc0fc9bd132ddfadd2a17eb1b0894f51

subject: engine : add suspend/resume support to watch resource
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-06 06:38:03.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/cloud_watch.py', 'heat/rpc/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_watch.py', 'heat/engine/watchrule.py', 'heat/tests/test_cw_alarm.py'], 'message': 'engine : add suspend/resume support to watch resource

Add suspend/resume support to CloudWatchAlarm resource and
underlying watchrule - this means that when in suspended
state watches will not allow new metric data to be added
or for alarm evaluation/actions to happen

blueprint stack-suspend-resume

Change-Id: Ic9a1c1bd86ac8156f260791089a38889eabc6528
'}]
commit_message:
engine : add suspend/resume support to watch resource

Add suspend/resume support to CloudWatchAlarm resource and
underlying watchrule - this means that when in suspended
state watches will not allow new metric data to be added
or for alarm evaluation/actions to happen

blueprint stack-suspend-resume

commit_message:
Port os-console-output extension to API v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I7e3519b2367184b34ac7e4df3edf7df38c870a02

revisions:

This fixes a small issue when you try to use console output length as a
float point value (as a float point itself not as string).
The extension was behaving as expected due to impossibility to fulfil the
request, returning bad request, but now this check in completelly done in api
level (it was partially done before) instead of wait until it fails behind the
rpc call.

Change-Id: Ifd7ce90dfd88acc8b22e7d190eafc3dd686186e9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix to integer cast of length in console output extension

This fixes a small issue when you try to use console output length as a
float point value (as a float point itself not as string).
The extension was behaving as expected due to impossibility to fulfil the
request, returning bad request, but now this check in completelly done in api
level (it was partially done before) instead of wait until it fails behind the
rpc call.

Naturally a test was added to explicit it and avoid future regression.

related to blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ifd7ce90dfd88acc8b22e7d190eafc3dd686186e9

commit_message:
Add unique constraints to Service.

Added unique constraints 'uniq_services0host0topic0deleted'
('host', 'topic', 'deleted') and 'uniq_services0host0binary0deleted'
('host', 'binary', 'deleted') to Service model and migrate sripts.
Added new exceptions `ServiceTopicExists` and `ServiceBinaryExists`.
Updated service_create(). Tests updated respectively.
Tests in test_compute updated to avoid conflicts with Service UC.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: I4d9d8cf38afc2fdca3eead65fced5001a1af209e

This patch removes the check in simple db. This is so both simple db and
sqlalchemy have the same behavior. We do not necessarily want to perform two

Fixes bug 1197057

Change-Id: Ibae37198b3854aa5dbe0e8a643a3d4b8608666c5
'}]
commit_message:
Dont raise NotFound in simple db image_tag_get_all

This patch removes the check in simple db. This is so both simple db and
sqlalchemy have the same behavior. We do not necessarily want to perform two
queries to see if the image exists so an empty list of tags is returned.

Fixes bug 1197057

Change-Id: Ibae37198b3854aa5dbe0e8a643a3d4b8608666c5

subject: Strip leading/trailing whitespace from reference License
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-25 12:45:31.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/core.py'], 'message': 'Strip leading/trailing whitespace from reference License

Some licenses are not indented at all, thereby missing a
leading space and failing the comparison. Given that
whitespace does not change the meaing of the license, it
is okay to remove it for the check.

Also adjust the print() statement which printed the
reference license as <license> and the actual license
as <apache2>, which is confusing for those who try
to understand what is going on.

Change-Id: I5d5c5fb67413848073d8ece2a723e98c111df1f1
'}]
commit_message:
Strip leading/trailing whitespace from reference License

Some licenses are not indented at all, thereby missing a
leading space and failing the comparison. Given that
whitespace does not change the meaing of the license, it
is okay to remove it for the check.

Also adjust the print() statement which printed the
reference license as <license> and the actual license
as <apache2>, which is confusing for those who try
to understand what is going on.

Change-Id: I5d5c5fb67413848073d8ece2a723e98c111df1f1

revisions:

Positional arguments now specify which collectors to use. This allows
disabling a collector if it is problematic, and also re-ordering of the

Change-Id: I7e76db991c0b16c529c1cbf9a1ba9beb78e45482

commit_message:
Allow changing the collectors that are used.

Positional arguments now specify which collectors to use. This allows
disabling a collector if it is problematic, and also re-ordering of the
emitted $OS_CONFIG_FILES from the default order if necessary.

Change-Id: I7e76db991c0b16c529c1cbf9a1ba9beb78e45482

subject: Ensure that README file makes it into the tarball
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-07 16:00:51.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'setup.cfg', 'MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Ensure that README file makes it into the tarball

setup.cfg depends on the README file for its long description, so if
it's not in the source tarball, the build will bomb out. README.rst is an
automatically grokked name of a file for python and gets included
automatically. While we're dealing with this, add a MANIFEST.in to
ensure that AUTHORS and ChangeLog get installed too.

Change-Id: Id59fa5a6fecc179a80710ba8a5dc898fb713b1cf
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that README file makes it into the tarball

setup.cfg depends on the README file for its long description, so if
it's not in the source tarball, the build will bomb out. README.rst is an
automatically grokked name of a file for python and gets included
automatically. While we're dealing with this, add a MANIFEST.in to
ensure that AUTHORS and ChangeLog get installed too.

Change-Id: Id59fa5a6fecc179a80710ba8a5dc898fb713b1cf

Migration 152 changed the type of `deleted` column from Boolean to
table.id.type for all tables. Also (as side effect) this migration
removed column `deleted` from indexes (in MySQL) or removed whole
indexes (in PostgreSQL). Current migration fixes these indexes.

Fixes bug 1191724

Change-Id: I3d95d102f379c3817bb372fefb1b12cf5de8a4db

commit_message:
Fixed columns list in indexes.

Migration 152 changed the type of `deleted` column from Boolean to
table.id.type for all tables. Also (as side effect) this migration
removed column `deleted` from indexes (in MySQL) or removed whole
indexes (in PostgreSQL). Current migration fixes these indexes.

Fixes bug 1191724

Change-Id: I3d95d102f379c3817bb372fefb1b12cf5de8a4db

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt. This
API call locates a suitable host within the same
cell (using nova-scheduler), and performs an update of the

commit_message:
Evacuate instance to a scheduled host

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt. This
API call locates a suitable host within the same
cell (using nova-scheduler), and performs an update of the
instance's location to the new host (similar to a rebuild). This
call is only available to users with the Admin role.

Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance
Change-Id: I950b958d3070d877540873398d6d6f90c84cfc61

subject: Put some order on os-refresh-config systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-07 07:07:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-refresh-config/install.d/01-os-refresh-config'], 'message': 'Put some order on os-refresh-config systemd

cloud-init is populating the file /var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data
with metadata and needs to happen before os-refresh-config is run
which in turn needs to happen before the cfn-hup cronjob.

Change-Id: I07fc60c4a165a42eeae1a8e5a20609a6e17fd790
'}]
commit_message:
Put some order on os-refresh-config systemd

cloud-init is populating the file /var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data
with metadata and needs to happen before os-refresh-config is run
which in turn needs to happen before the cfn-hup cronjob.

Change-Id: I07fc60c4a165a42eeae1a8e5a20609a6e17fd790

revisions:

"}]
commit_message:
Stop patching the GenericResource's property_schema

This is causing test failures if you add a new test
and don't reset the scema to {}, this seems to be timing
related. Just add Resource types that we need prevents the
need for this patching.

Change-Id: If7ddd2b1ffa8b54025c0369fe8c4f7440f0e3cdc

subject: Fix inconsistency between Nova-Net and Quantum
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-06-25 14:35:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py', 'nova/network/quantumv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix inconsistency between Nova-Net and Quantum

The quantum client raises QuantumClientException (status_code 409)
that is not unknown for nova, and is translated in 500 computeFault.
Catching this exception in nova/nova/network/quantumv2/api.py and
raising it as exception.NoMoreFloatingIps solves the problem.

Handle exception if floating ip pool is not found

Change-Id: I290bc8b58e13195c2ee50ea9063c0dbedc4c414a
Fixes: bug #1194460
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistency between Nova-Net and Quantum

The quantum client raises QuantumClientException (status_code 409)
that is not unknown for nova, and is translated in 500 computeFault.
Catching this exception in nova/nova/network/quantumv2/api.py and
raising it as exception.NoMoreFloatingIps solves the problem.

Handle exception if floating ip pool is not found

Change-Id: I290bc8b58e13195c2ee50ea9063c0dbedc4c414a
Fixes: bug #1194460

commit_message:
Import WritableLogger from oslo

glance/common/wsgi.py contains a WritableLogger, the same code can be
imported from oslo.

Set the logging level to DEBUG to match current behaviour (oslo uses
INFO by default).

Fixes bug 1194274

Change-Id: If41c64672f566ce381a3954b69351c8187b6ca0b

commit_message:
Add cinder cleanup to migrations.

After deep review actual db state and models i found
few tables in database skipped in db.models.
After moving of cinder in separate project these tables
were not removed.

Tables for deletion:
- sm_flavors
- sm_backend_config
- sm_volume
- virtual_storage_arrays
- volume_metadata
- volume_types
- volume_type_extra_specs
- shadow_sm_flavors
- shadow_sm_backend_config
- shadow_sm_volume
- shadow_virtual_storage_arrays
- shadow_volume_metadata
- shadow_volume_types
- shadow_volume_type_extra_specs

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I67e9f643419b1f43e544837c5e89470d274cd7ae

subject: Adds support for RabbitMQ Clustering
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-01 16:41:06.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_rabbitmq_spec.rb', 'manifests/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': 'Adds support for RabbitMQ Clustering

Prior to this change, only a single RabbitMQ Broker
could be deployed by the nova::rabbitmq class.

This change implements the cluster_disk_nodes parameter
that can enable RabbitMQ clustering.

Defaults to false for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Iac2d04e855adb53fbb9fe2a23f8773a692162744
'}]
commit_message:
Adds support for RabbitMQ Clustering

Prior to this change, only a single RabbitMQ Broker
could be deployed by the nova::rabbitmq class.

This change implements the cluster_disk_nodes parameter
that can enable RabbitMQ clustering.

Defaults to false for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Iac2d04e855adb53fbb9fe2a23f8773a692162744

subject: Add Quantum metadata proxy documentation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-05 20:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/app_core.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/ch_overview.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/ch_install.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/ch_adv_config.xml'], 'message': 'Add Quantum metadata proxy documentation

Document metadata_agent.ini - includes auth_* and admin_* flags needed
for the Quantum client as the metadata agent does not seem to be able
to read these from quantum.conf even though it is on the command line.
Removed section in advanced config options about the need for
additional routing as this no longer applies.

Fixes bug 1099573

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/34576

Change-Id: I2f5b73d5a6bd2add27f9dd46ad2ca1d6db832b1c
'}]
commit_message:
Add Quantum metadata proxy documentation

Document metadata_agent.ini - includes auth_* and admin_* flags needed
for the Quantum client as the metadata agent does not seem to be able
to read these from quantum.conf even though it is on the command line.
Removed section in advanced config options about the need for
additional routing as this no longer applies.

Fixes bug 1099573

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/34576

Change-Id: I2f5b73d5a6bd2add27f9dd46ad2ca1d6db832b1c

commit_message:
Rename Quantum to Neutron

This change renames everything to Neutron while providing backwards
compatible adjustments for Grizzly configuration files.

implements blueprint: remove-use-of-quantum

Change-Id: Ie7d07ba7c89857e13d4ddc8f0e9b68de020a3d19
